loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Debbie works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling chicken. Debbie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Debbie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María Rosario tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en el Caserío de Culpon que pertenece al distrito de Nueva Arica, la cual es una zona rural, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (patos, pavos y cerdos) con gran experiencia en el negocio, su esposo se dedica a las labores de jornalería en zonas las parcelas de sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de animales que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mayor precio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Rosario is 40 years old. She is married, with one son in her care. She lives in the small village of Culpon, which is in the Nueva Arica district, a rural area in which the population works in agriculture, business, and ranching. It is in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small farm animals (ducks, turkeys, and pigs) and has much experience in the business. Her husband works as a day laborer on the land of their neighbors and inhabitants of their district.

She has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy a variety of animals, which will allow her to offer them at a higher price and thus generate a larger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of small animals to offer her customers

loans.name: Graciana

texts.en:
Graciana is 65 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Graciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries, such as bread, snack foods, soft drinks, eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Graciana has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, snack foods, soft drinks, eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Graciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, such as bread, snack foods, soft drinks, eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 33 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marjorie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: La Confianza Group

texts.es: El grupo se encuentra integrado por cinco socios, coordinado por el señor Mercedes de 54 años de edad y soltero, se dedica a la venta de derivados del maíz como tamales pisque, güirila, tamales rellenos en el mercado de granada, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en quintal de maíz, leña, hojas, cal, atado de dulce, etc., con el fin de mejorar sus ingreso. Otra integrante del grupo es la señora Concepción con 46 años de edad propietaria de una floristería este negocio lo impulso hace diez años, la señora Dora de 26 años de edad propietaria  de una pulpería y una vulcanización hace 2 años, la señora Esperanza de 52 años de edad comercializa cosechas de frutas de acuerdo a temporada y señora Margarita vende tamales pisque en el mercado de municipal desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group is made up of five members coordinated by Mercedes, who is 54 years old and single.  He makes a living selling corn products such as "pisque" tamales [bean tamales], corn pancakes, and stuffed tamales in the market in Granada.

He's requesting the loan to buy a quintal of corn, firewood, leaves, lime, unrefined cane sugar, etc., so he can improve his income.

The other members of the group are Concepción, 46, who has a flower shop she started 10 years ago; Dora, 26, who has owned a grocery store and a tire repair business for two years; Esperanza, 52, who sells harvests of seasonal fruit; and Margarita, who has been selling pisque tamales in the city market for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy a quintal of corn, firewood, leaves, lime, unrefined whole cane sugar, etc.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pelagia still dreams to have another unit of tricycle. She also hopes for her family to have sufficiency in life, good health and security. She faithfully meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Maina

texts.en: Maina is a 37-year-old married woman with eight children. She runs a plantation business, selling her crops to the public and also to the members of her community. She also runs a canteen business as another source of income to help take care of her family financially. She plans to use this money to purchase flour, sugar, chicken leg quarters, and cooking oil for her canteen and taro roots and chemicals for her plantation. With her large family, she was grateful for the opportunity to join South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) more than 3 years ago because she is now able to take care of her family financially and improve the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, chicken leg quarters, cooking oil, taro roots, and chemicals

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 53 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mely has been in this business for 30 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 35 years old and has a live-in partner with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Angie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angie has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Mila is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una joven luchadora que con esfuerzo y sacrificio de sus padres está saliendo adelante, y está estudiando. Pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
Está estudiando la licenciatura en farmacia, con lo que pretende poder ayudar a sus familias y sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la pagar sus cuotas, con lo cual podrá seguir estudiando y luchando por poder cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Gloria is a determined young woman who is getting ahead and attending university, thanks to her efforts and her parents' sacrifices. She is putting forth her maximum effort so that she can achieve her goal of being someone in life. 

She is studying for a professional degree in Pharmacy, with which she intends to be able to help her family members and loved ones. She is requesting this loan to invest in paying her tuition, which will allow her to keep studying and working hard to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 06 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Lương works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 30 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 02 Thôn 06 Quảng Lưu solidarity group. 

This is Lương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elsa works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Elsa is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy ingredients, such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc., for her food production business.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: 45 Tây Hòa, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khiên works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. Khiên is 45 years old and married with three children. Khiên is the group leader of the 45 Tây Hòa, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2013, Khiên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khiên has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Khiên hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa, 50, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Anselmo who also is a farmer. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Teresa operates a pineapple farm. She grows pineapple on their farm located in Cavite. It is in the highlands, an area suited to growing pineapple. She sells her product at the market, to fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm.

Teresa hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María esta luchando para que por medio de sus estudios pueda ser una profesional útil a la sociedad, ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda. Agradece por aquella oportunidad recibida.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo y lo quiere invertir nuevamente en pagar sus gastos de transporte, ya que ello implica un gasto del día a día. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda como lo fue el préstamo anterior.
texts.en:
Maria is working hard to, through her studies, become a professional that is useful to society. She says that her previous loan was used to cover her transportation costs, which was of great help to her. She thanks the lenders for the opportunity she received. 

Today, she asks for a new loan and she wants to invest it once again to pay for her transportation costs, as this represents a daily expense. She thanks the lenders for the opportunity that she is receiving and affirms that it will be of great use to her, just like the previous loan.

loans.use: to cover her transportation costs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Nenita requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow (NWTF) to purchase additional cloth, thread, and equipment for her tailoring business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth, thread, and equipment for her tailoring business

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita vive en la Ciudad de San Pedro, tiene 6 hermanos, donde sus padres se encargan de solventar los gastos de su facultad para poder terminar sus estudios y poder ser una persona respetada en el futuro, también para poder ayudar económicamente a sus padres.
Edita quiere ser abogada, y es por ello que se está esforzando para poder cumplir con sus metas. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula de manera íntegra, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en: Edita lives in the city of San Pedro and has 6 siblings. Her parents are in charge of paying for her university expenses, so that she can finish her education and become a respected person in the future. She hopes to later be able to help her parents financially. Edita wants to be a lawyer and that is why she is making an effort to be able to achieve her goals. She is requesting this loan to pay for her university tuition. She thanks the lenders for the opportunity that she is receiving, which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma is 46 years old and has children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Norma has been in this business for 18 years. 

Norma successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Norma requested a 25,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow (NWTF) to buy additional fishing nets for her business. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Bolortuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Bolortuya, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works as a plasterer for a private company. Her husband earns income by running a taxi with his car for local people. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land.

Mrs. Bolortuya is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Mongolian tugrigs (MNT) to enlarge her house and buy some building materials, such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel, vacuum windows, and materials for the interior. If she expands her one-room house, her family will feel more comfort in their home.

loans.use: to enlarge her house and buy some building materials

loans.name: Domingo Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Domingo Leonel, tiene un negocio de venta frutas y verduras en unos de los mercados  del departamento de León, desde hace cinco años, inicia sus labores a las 04:00 am finalizándolas a las 06:00 pm, realiza este trabajo para el sustento de su familia, él es padre de un 1 hijo pequeño.  

Don Domingo solicito este  crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de plátanos, papayas y melones, al por mayor lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias y le brindará una mejor estabilidad a su negocio.
texts.en:
Domingo Leonel has a small business selling fruits and vegetables in of of the markets in the Leon region. He has had this business for 5 years. He starts working at 4:00 a.m. and finishes at 6:00 p.m. This occupation allows him to support his family. He has one small son.

Domingo requests this loan from Ceprodel and Kiva to buy plantains, papayas and melons in bulk, which will allow him to increase his profits and will provide more stability to his business.

loans.use: to buy plantains, papayas and melons.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina, es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno está a su cargo, ella  labora como comerciante en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desempeñando esta labor desde hace 14 años, inicia sus labores a las 07:00 am con la elaboración de Refrescos naturales posterior se traslada hasta su puesto de trabajo finalizando a las 01:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a domingo, ella  realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar.   

Doña Rosalina,  solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizo para compra de un Freezer lo cual le permitirá elaborar hielo y así aumentar su capital de trabajo y sus ganancias brindándole un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Rosalina has 4 children, all of whom she is no longer in charge of. She works in a small business at one of the markets in the city of Leon. She has had this occupation for 14 years. She starts working at 7:00 a.m. with the preparation of natural soft-drinks. She then goes to her business and finishes at 1:00 p.m. She has the same schedule from Monday to Sunday. This occupation allows her to support her home. Rosalina requested a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva to buy a freezer, which will allow her to make ice and that way increase her working capital and her profits, which will help her obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Nhóm 02, Thôn Xuân Thịnh, Yên Mỹ Group

texts.en:
Đông is 32 years old and is married with two children. She has had an agricultural business raising poultry for the past 10 years. Đông is applying for a loan to purchase more baby chickens to raise and sell. The main hardship that Đông faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Đông is the group leader of the Nhóm 02, Thôn Xuân Thịnh, Yên Mỹ solidarity group which consists of four members. 

In 2012, Đông joined Fund for Thanh Hoa  Poor Women to improve her business and, since then, she has successfully repaid six loans.

In the future, she hopes her business to do well and to continue to be successful, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores owns and operates a jeepney. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by generating profit from her ornamental plant business.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 20,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney and to buy more ornamental plants and supplies needed in her business.

In the future, Dolores wants to improve the general living conditions of her family and dreams of having another jeepney to operate for business.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Fellowship groups are composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney.

loans.name: 13 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Hương is 50 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hương has operated a small restaurant selling soup for the past six years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hương is the group leader of the 13 Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group which consists of six members. 

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and, since then, has successfully repaid four loans. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to make soup to sell.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make soup to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 34 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Teresa has been running a direct selling  business selling Avon products in the Philippines for the past three years.

Teresa has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Warna Sari Group

texts.en:
As agreed, the Warna Sari Group made their payment on June 18, 2014. With 10 members, they made a payment together of 15.000.000 IDR. During the loan period, they managed the pigs well.  With the instructions from their Vet, the group kept the pigs by giving them nutritious feed and vitamins.

Luh sold her piglets and earned a net profit of 1,500,000 IDR after deducting the cost of feed and making her payment. She’s really happy for that and decided to continue her loan to increase the number of her pigs. All the profits were used for her family's daily needs and school fees.

After calculating and evaluating the last period, the Warna Sari group decided to continue their loan. This new loan was used for increasing their pig businesses by purchasing new piglets or quality feed. The group received an increased loan amount. Each of them got 2.000.000 IDR.

Luh used her loan to purchase three super quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated the cage. She plans to sell the pigs near the holiday to get a good price. She hopes her plan runs well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their bussines until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the business by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase three super quality piglets

loans.name: 18 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from FPW. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs. 

Lan is 48 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Lan is the group leader of the 18 Phú Son 1 Solidarity Group, which consists of six members.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for many years, and has repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday necessities.

In relation to this, Elvie would like to take out a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 30,000 which will also pay for the maintenance of the tricycle and renewal of the franchise agreement/permit so she can continue her business operation.

In the future, Elvie wants to buy another tricycle unit for business purposes. She hopes to improve their general living conditions and to give her children a good quality education.

Elvie meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and so she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories, maintenance, and for renewal of the franchise agreement/permit for her motorized tricycle.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
María Virginia tiene 58 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de corral, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para una mejor produccion de leche de su ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
María Virginia, 58, lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district, located in Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

She has made a living for several years buying and selling farm animals.  Her business is located behind her home.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy balanced feed to get better milk production from her dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to get better milk production from her cows

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna owns a boutique and a retail shop in Misamis Occidental. She earns additional income from farming. She started the business in 2010 to improve her standard of living. 

Myrna hopes to expand the business and for this reason, she joined GDMPC to gain access to micro-finance. She has borrowed a loan to buy more boutique stock and cosmetic products to sell.

In the future, Myrna wants to improve her business and build a store for her retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy more boutique stock and cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Nhoms 01 Thôn 06 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 32 years old and is married with two children. She has had an agricultural business raising poultry for nine years. Her most critical business difficulty is the lack of capital.

Hoa is the group leader of the Nhoms 01 Thôn 06 Quảng Lưu solidarity group which consists of five members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby chickens to raise and sell.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her children, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 35 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Lourdes works very hard to provide for the family.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more items, such as detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell. Lourdes has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Santos Felicita

texts.es:
La señora Santos Felicita, es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales ninguno está bajo su responsabilidad y  labora vendiendo comida en unos de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace seis años, inicia sus labores a las 05:00 am con la elaboración de su producto posteriormente se traslada a su puesto de trabajo para la comercialización del mismo y finaliza a las 04:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado.  

El crédito que solicito la señora Santos Felicita a Ceprodel lo utilizó para la Compra de puertas y ventanas para acondicionar su humilde vivienda y de esa manera ontendrá un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Felicita is the mother of 5 children, none of whom remains under her care. For six years now, she has worked selling food in one of the markets in the city of León. From Monday to Sunday, she begins her working day at 5:00 am making her product, afterwards she moves to her work stall to sell it, and finishes at 4:00 pm. 

The loan that Mrs. Santos Felicita requested from Ceprodel was used to purchase doors and windows to improve her humble home, and that way obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows

loans.name: 43 Thái Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Đào is 59 years old and is married with two children. Đào has had an agricultural business raising pigs for the past five years. Her most critical business difficulty is the lack of capital.

Đào is the group leader of the 43 Thái Hòa Hưng Lộc solidarity group which consists of five members. 

In 2013, Đào joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has successfully repaid one loan. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more piglets to raise and sell.

With her business profit, Đào hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 57 years old and has a live-in partner with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Martina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Martina has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 60 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Yolanda has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 10 years and earns additional income from farming sugar cane.

Yolanda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

She aspires to save money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and basic grains.

loans.name: 05-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Oanh is 46 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Oanh has operated a small restaurant selling rice noodles for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Oanh is the group leader of the 05-Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group which consists of four members. 

In 2012, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business and, since then, she has successfully repaid three loans. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more food and tables, chairs, etc. to operate her small restaurant.

With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy more food and tables, chairs, etc. to operate her small restaurant

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
As the married parent of five children, Merle works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Merle is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merle has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Myrna has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from raising pigs and retailing rice.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 48 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Myrna has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Kasa

texts.en: Kasa is a 39-year-old single woman with three children. She wants to start a business to take care of her family; thus the reason for just deciding to join the SPBD program. She would like to sell soft drinks not only to school kids but also to the members of her community and believes she would be able to make a decent profit out of it. With this money, she will purchase crates of canned soft drinks, a new freezer and a cooler to help start up her business. Kasa hopes to save some of the profits she would be able to make to provide for her family's essential needs and reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase crates of canned soft drinks, a new freezer and a cooler.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Nhóm 03, Thôn Trung Tâm, Yên Mỹ Group

texts.en:
Trình works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Trình is 32 years old and she is married with two children..

Trình is the group leader of the Nhóm 03, thôn Trung Tâm, Yên Mỹ solidarity group, which consists of six members.

In 2012, Trình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Trình faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Virgie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Virgie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and groceries. Sri lives in Purwokerto, a semiurban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Sri is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Sri began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, hair conditioner, coffee, creamer, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, hair conditioner, coffee, creamer, cereals, noodles, etc.

Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, hair conditioner, coffee, creamer, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Khadim, âgé de la trentaine d’année, s’active dans le domaine de l’élevage depuis quelques années. Il habite dans un village situé à environ 8 kilomètres de la ville principale. Il est marié et père de famille. Khadim possède une vache et pour fructifier, il veut acheter un bœuf et les mettre ensemble pour faire de l’embouche. Il a aménagé un espace pour pouvoir faire cette activité normalement et pouvoir en tirer un profit. Il vit avec ses parents et ses frères et ils s’organisent pour la dépense quotidienne. 
Khadim souhaite élargir son élevage et avoir un grand troupeau.
texts.en: Mr. Khadim, 30-something years old, has been active in the domain of livestock farming for a few years. He lives in a village located about 8 km from the main town. He is a married father of a family. Khadim owns a cow, and for reproduction purposes, he wants to purchase a bull and put them together to raise. He has fixed up a space to be able to do this ordinarily and to make a profit. He lives with his parents and brothers, and they make arrangements for their day-to-day expenses. Khadim wishes to expand his livestock farming and have a large herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and resell

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Ibrahima est mécanicien de profession, il travaille dans un garage non loin du guichet. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Comme chaque année, il cultive son champ c’est pourquoi il sollicite un crédit de 150 000F pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais. Il a des frères qui sont au village et qui s’occupent en permanence de surveiller l’activité. A la fin, ils se partageront les recettes et cela pourra lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
Ibrahima souhaite avoir son propre atelier et travailler pour son propre compte car il a beaucoup de clients personnels qui volontiers le suivront où il irait.
texts.en: Ibrahima is a mechanic by trade. He works in a garage not far from the branch office. He is a married father of two children. Each year, Ibrahima farms his field, and this is why he is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. His brothers in the village are occupied with keeping an eye on this activity. In the end, they all share in the receipts, thus enabling him to improve his family’s food situation. Ibrahima wishes to have his own workshop and to work for himself, since he has many customers of his own who will volunteerily follow him wherever he goes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Kasia

texts.en: Kasia is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She prints elei materials and sell them as lavalavas or she has them as designs for two-piece dresses or shirts that she sews and sells to the members of her community or to the public. With this loan, she will purchase elei print designs, fabric paints, glitter, fabric materials, paint brushes and rolls for her elei and sewing business. She has managed to meet her family's everyday essential needs ever since she has started making profits from her business without depending on other family members.

loans.use: To purchase elei print designs, fabric paints, glitter, fabric materials, paint brushes and rolls

loans.name: Novylinda

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Novylinda works hard to support her family.

She has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fertilized duck eggs. Novylinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy an additional computer for her internet cafe business.

Novylinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and sell them in her salon

loans.name: Los Meneses Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas, lo coordina la señora Migdalia de 46 años de edad y casada, quien es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace nueve años, y solicita el crédito para mantener su negocio, debido a que este es su fuente de ingreso, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pan, galletas, jabón para lavar ropa, jabón de baño, caramelos, gaseosas, jugos, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras, Julia de 53 años vende tortillas, helados y refrescos, e Ileana comerciante de ropa, refrescos, helados, frijoles y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is made up of three successful members. It is coordinated by Migdalia, a 46-year-old married woman, who has been the owner of a general store for 9 years. She is requesting a loan to maintain her business since this is her source of income. She is requesting the loan to buy basic grains like rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, cookies, laundry soap, bath soap, candy, soda, juice, etc. 

The other members are Julia and Ileana. Julia, 53-years-old, sells tortillas, ice cream, and soft drinks, and Ileana sells clothing, soft drinks, ice cream, beans, and also raises pigs.

loans.use: to buy basic grains like rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, cookies, laundry soap, bath soap, candy, soda, juice, etc.

loans.name: Bonita

texts.en:
Bonita is a 28-year-old single woman with one child. She is planning to make and sell elei printed lavalavas (stamped sarongs), which she will sell to the public around town or deliver to the shops nearby. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance so she could start up her business to take care of her child. 

With this loan, she will purchase fabric materials, fabric paint, paint brushes and rolls, and designed board for her elei business. With the profits she will be making from her business, she plans to save some of them for the future of her child and also reinvest some of them back into her business

loans.use: to purchase fabric materials, fabric paint, paint brushes and rolls, and designed boards

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Expedita is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Expedita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Expedita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Expedita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Expedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Roda has been in this business for eight years. Roda earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Roda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Tofaga

texts.en: Tofaga is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation business from which she sells to the members of her community and also to the traveling public. She also sells ice cake as another means of earning extra income and has been doing this for more than five years. She plans to use this loan to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, tools and equipment for the improvement of her plantation, cement, bricks, nails, iron roofing and timber for her home renovation, and school fees and school uniforms for her children. Tofaga has managed to provide for some of her family's essential everyday needs from the profits she has been earning from her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, tools and equipment, cement, bricks, nails, iron roofing, timber, school fees and school uniforms

loans.name: Massaer

texts.fr:
Monsieur Massaer, âgé de 65 ans, marié et père de famille, habite dans un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville. Il s’active dans le domaine de l’agriculture depuis son jeune âge et a toujours accompagné ses parents dans les champs. Ainé dans sa famille, il a continué dans cette activité depuis longtemps. Il vient solliciter pour 3ème fois un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des semences et de l’engrais pour cultiver son champ. Il a ses enfants qu’il initie déjà à ce travail des champs et qui actuellement font presque tout le travail. La dépense quotidienne est gérée par son fils ainé qui travaille en ville.
Monsieur Massaer envisage aussi de faire de l’embouche bovine, impliquer plus ces enfants pour pouvoir leur laisser cet héritage.
texts.en:
Mr. Massaer, aged 65, is married and a father. He lives in a village a few kilometers from the city. He has been active in agriculture from an early age and has always accompanied his parents in the fields. Eldest of his family, he has been performing this activity for a long time.

For the third time he is requesting a loan that will enable him to buy seeds and fertilizer to cultivate his field. He has already taught his children to work in the fields and they currently handle almost all the work. Daily expenditures are managed by his eldest son who works in the city.

Mr. Massaer is also planning to fatten cattle, and involve his children more to leave them with this legacy.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer to grow crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy seasonal fruit and various products (cassava flour, sugar, flat-cakes, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy food products and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy haberdashery items, shoes and fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Flora has a business selling electrical spare parts in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of electrical spare parts to sell.

Flora has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of electrical spare parts to sell

loans.name: Etelini

texts.en: Etelini is a 69-year-old widow with seven children. She runs a small business selling barbecue in her community and has been doing this for three years. Etelini has requested a loan to buy a new barbecue set, tongs, mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, Chinese onions, paper plates and plastic spoons. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Etelini will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new barbecue set, tongs, mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, Chinese onions, paper plates and plastic spoons

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda has a live-in partner and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, nails, paints, etc., for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, nails, paints, etc., for her business

loans.name: Kusudio Group

texts.en:
Anjelina is a mother of six children; one is schooling and the rest are grown-up. She is in her 50s. Anjelina, who is divorced, has been taking care of her family with a food selling business (known as a mamalishe). She has been in this business for nine years now. She cooks rice, bananas and ugali with meat, beans, vegetables and sometimes fish. She also serves breakfast: soup and tea with donuts, chapati and other snacks. She starts business very early in the morning, at 4:30 a.m., when she organizes food ingredients that are required for that day, like going to the butcher to find fresh and healthier meat.  She has business helpers, and all business issues end by midnight daily. She is able to make a good profit monthly. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Anjelina will use this loan to buy food cooking ingredients (rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, a sack of maize and baking flour). She dreams that one day she will be able to own a hotel together with a chips business. 

Anjelina will share this loan with her loan group, "KUSUDIO," which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients (rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, a sack of maize and baking flour).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and married with seven children, with one child still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, noodles, shampoo, sugar, juice, etc.

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes works hard to support her family. Agnes is married and has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy tools  and materials for her vulcanizing business.

Agnes has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Agnes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for her vulcanizing business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. Conchita is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for 23 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Ludovico, her husband, works as a construction worker. She sells fresh fish while managing their junk shop and scrap-trading business at the same time. Her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

Candelaria buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products, since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

Candelaria is taking out an 18,000 PHP loan assistance to continue operations of her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish, which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she wants her business to continue to flourish, and she desires for her children to finish schooling.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish to be sold at the market.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is married with six children. She is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. Remedios is a farmer, and she cultivates rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years with the help of her husband. 

She has requested a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma  is 67 years old and married with 11 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jennifer is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 39 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Jocel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Jocel has been in this business for five years. 

In the future Jocel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food products and seasonal fruit

loans.name: Sobirin

texts.en:
Sobirin runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and he is a private employee, too. Sobirin lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. He is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Sobirin began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Khairul

texts.en:
Khairul runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. Khairul lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Khairul is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Khairul began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita has been operating her own retail business for 12 years and she earns well enough from this that she has improved her piggery business and successfully repaid her previous loan used for feeding supplies. To boost her pig business, she took a new loan recently to purchase feeding supplies and vitamins.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies and vitamins

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products and grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for a new 55,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou dreams that her business will be more successful and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

Note: All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her general store business.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jonah works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from direct selling. Jonah is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. 

Jonah has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina, 36 years old, is a married female with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a shoe business, which she has been running since 2009. She began the business to have a source of income to cater to her family's needs. Justina is hardworking. However, she is faced with the problem of competition and price fluctuation. Educating her children and building a commercial house are her dreams. 

Justina intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Makuti A Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her 30s, is single and has four children, two of whom are in school, one is still small and another is grown. For five years now, she has been managing a food business and a small project of madera (a Muslim type of dresses). She runs her clothing sales business from 9 am to noon, and from noon to 4 pm, she serves food. Her food business does not operate from morning to midnight due to the nature of the place and the small amount of capital she has (customers start to flow at noontime, just for lunch). She dreams of expanding her businesses and becoming a successful person. Asha is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fifth loan request, which she will use to replace her old business cooking equipment with new and replenish her food ingredients. With the previous credit she received from Tujijenge, she replenished her store with food ingredients and started selling madera. She managed to repay all her loans successfully. Asha earned a profit, which she used to cover her family's food expenses and school fees. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Makuti A", which consists of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new cooking equipment and food ingredients.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 41-year-old man with eight children, five of whom go to school and he lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows cocoa. He started a retail shop to supplement his daily income to handle his family's basic needs, especially school fees for his children. He hopes to educate his children to higher levels of education. However, limited capital hinders his plans.
 
He wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as cigarettes and Vaseline to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as cigarettes and vaseline to sell.

loans.name: Dionalyn

texts.en: Dionalyn is 30 years old, married and lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him by growing rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional fertilizer. She plans to grow other crops such as vegetables and bananas in order to generate more income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en:
Neriza has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than 10 years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. The couple has to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Neriza would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 15,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Neriza hopes to ensure her soon-to-be-grocery store is up and running. She desires for her family to always be happy and healthy.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson has been farming for eight years and is able to provide for his family's basic needs. He plants and harvests rice to sell in the local community in order to earn a living. Aside from this, he also earns by working for hire in the neighborhood. Despite the difficulties in earning money, Wilson was able to repay his previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) successfully. He used it for improvements on his farm. Recently, he borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer for his rice production business. In the future, Wilson would like to save in order to have a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel used the previous loan to buy electronic wires to sell. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda where he has been operating a workshop, electronics and wiring business in addition to farming to earn a living. He hopes to educate all his children and expand his business into new markets despite the challenge of inadequate capital. Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy more electronic wires to sell.

loans.use: to buy more electronic wires to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase wood, bamboo, paints, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Rosario has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood, bamboo, and paint to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Maclaren Group

texts.en:
Magdalena, who is in her early 50s, is married with five grown-up children. She has been selling charcoal for eighteen years now. She works from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Magdalena's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing on the charcoal stock by buying more sacks. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell at wholesale and retail prices. She dreams of building her own house on the plot of land she has.

Magdalena will share this loan with her loan group "Maclaren" which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell at wholesale and retail prices.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. With her generated income, she was able to set up a swine fattening business that brings better income for the family. 

To improve it, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to have additional capital for her swine fattening business so she can buy feeds. She's been in business for fourteen years and it sustains their living.

She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business, to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her swine fattening business so she can buy feeds.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 54 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business doing direct selling of Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Sherlita has borrowed and paid back 34 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling of Avon products business for 25 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in her previous loan that improved her living standards.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Active Group

texts.en:
Veronica is the featured representative of the Active group. She and the other group members left their homes in the Philippines to find better work opportunities in Lebanon. They are all best friends which led them to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, since it was their only hope of improving the well being of their families back home.

Veronica is a 44-year-old married mother of four. The difficult economic situation in the Philippines forced her to separate herself from her loved ones so that she can provide them with better living conditions while working abroad as a housekeeper.

Veronica is an ambitious woman who will do anything to help her family. The loan she acquired is going to help make her family back home more financially comfortable while Veronica continues to work hard in Lebanon. Veronica is standing in the middle of the photo,  Maribeth is on the left, and Leny is on the right.

loans.use: To help make her family back home more financially comfortable while Veronica continues to work hard in Lebanon.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 18,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of the franchise agreement / permit so she can continue her business operation.

Melanie hopes that their tricycle will always be in good condition. She also wants to buy another unit of tricycle to increase their income.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha owns and operates a  farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. She's been in business for sixteen years and it sustains their living. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for their farm.  

She plans to use the additional profit generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides  to spray the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk and butter to sell.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 38 years and lives in Kagadi Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy dried cassava and secondhand clothes to sell. 

For the last 11 years he has operated a retail shop in addition to farming and selling clothes. His businesses are challenged by competition from people with similar business. However, through the earnings he hopes to educate his children. 

Due to his hard work, he is requesting a loan to buy textile clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy textile clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past six years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a 28-year-old single man and the sole earner out of six in his family. Elie has been refinishing furniture for 11 years, and his bosses often remark on his reliability and excellent quality of work. He has a steady income, but it is just enough to cover all the increasing demands of his family. 

Elie is an ambitious man who believes in taking advantage of every opportunity in life. He acquired a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase the equipment he needs to open a workshop of his own. Elie has the experience and vision to succeed, and he looks forward to opening up his shop soon.

loans.use: To purchase the equipment he needs to open a workshop of his own.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single mother of three children aged between 10 and 2. She lives in Hoima, Uganda. She also takes care of one of her late sister's dependents. She sells drugs for people in a shop. She earns additional income from farming. Grace is a hard working lady who desires to build a residential house and boys quarters. Price fluctuations and high license fees hinder her sales.

She is acquiring a loan to start building a residential house.

loans.use: to start building a residential house.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used in the maintenance of her tricycle and in buying the needed spare parts and accessories. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. She will also use the loan for her tricycle and in her buying and selling business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Corazon dreams to have more customers and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking woman who has been providing for her family. The previous loan helped her to buy cows to sell. 

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase two cows to sell. In addition she sells cereals to supplement her income.

loans.use: to purchase two cows to sell.

loans.name: Waridi

texts.en:
This is Waridi. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. Alima still operates a food stall, preparing various food. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
