Leocadia is alone to provide for the needs of her five children - which she does by managing her rice farm. Aside from this, she also grows vegetables in her garden to earn extra income. 

She needs to improve her farm for it is the main source of income. Without hesitation, she took a loan from GDMPC micro finance to use as additional capital for rice production and to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. Her future plan is to build a piggery where she can raise pigs as an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Monica is a mother of two daughters, one is small and another is grown. She is aged in her mid-thirties and is not married. She has been taking care of her family with three good businesses; 1) a grocery selling spirits, beers, soft drinks and wine; 2) catering and lastly 3) poultry where she keeps broiler chickens. Monica has been involved in these activities for seven years now and is able to make a good profit each month. She starts business from 06am and works until midnight daily. 

Monica is requesting her 14th credit via Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to buy all current catering equipment and replenished her grocery with more drinks. She received a profit and she used it to plow back into her business so as to grow it. She covered school fees and home food expenses. Monica is really working hard and she has a great ambition of becoming a successful woman.  She is so happy with Kiva lenders who made her income-sources grow. She will use this loan to buy serving dishes for food - to buy missing catering equipment. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Nadia" which consist of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy serving dishes for food.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing a PHP loan through NWTF to buy cloth, thread and additional materials for her tailoring business for her tailoring business.

Valeriana has been in this business for 15 years. Valeriana earns additional income from food-vending.

Valeriana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia  is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

Virginia  has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Virginia  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has been helping on their rice farm to make a living. Over the past twelve years, the couple have improved their methods of farming, and are now doing well. 

With her income, she successfully repaid he previous loan used for farming. To maintain the farm, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer. In the future, Lilia wants to improve her house and see her children successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea has been operating her own fruit and vegetable stand for many years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially those of her four children. The couple have had to work hard, and are determined to get a better income to provide their children with a better education, that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Irenea would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fruits and vegetables. With an amount of PHP 20,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of fruits, veggies and other items needed to expand her inventory. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Irenea dreams that her business will expand. She hopes to be always physically strong and fit for work so that she can for provide their every day needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different vegetables and different seasonings needed in her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and has four school-going children. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Anna has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mariecris

texts.en:
Mariecris owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. She's been in business for eight years while her husband works as a security guard to contribute to their living. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs for fertilization and maintenance in order to gain more returns for the family. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for fertilization and maintenance.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 60 years old and married with four children. With children in school, Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Ofelia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 48 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Lucia has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly works hard to support her family. Nelly is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Nelly has been in this business for 9 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 39-year-old married man with 10 children between the ages of 17 and 13. They all attend school and live in Kagadi, Uganda where he operates an electronic shop alongside farming to earn a living. 

Emmanuel is challenged by having a lot of competitors and by price fluctuations. His vision is to enter into a contract with one of the mobile phone companies to become a major distributor in the area and also to educate his children. 

Since he is hardworking, he is asking for a loan to buy more phones and phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phones and phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large and she works hard to make both ends meet.

Here again she comes to you, requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy maize flour, wheat flour, beans and rice to cook in her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, beans and rice to cook in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase material to build a shop so that she can rent it out.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments for sauce and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of phones accessories to face all the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Marta Mirian

texts.es:
Marta de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, tiene 6 hijos, esta casada su esposo es vigilante de la alcaldía del municipio donde vive, y  son padres de 3 hijos que estudian.

Marta vende queso y venta de tamales, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz con la ayuda de sus esposo y de sus 3 hijos. Marta es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de superación.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra. 


A marta le gustaría tener una pequeña tienda en su casa, también le gustaría comprar unas 3 vacas, y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta, 43, studied up to ninth grade.  She is married and they have six children, three of whom attend school..  Her husband is a security guard for the city hall in the town where she lives.

Marta sells cheese and tamales.  She cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn with the help of her husband and three children.  Marta's a hardworking woman who wants to improve herself.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy corn seed, soil amendments, herbicide, and pesticide, and to pay for labor.

Marta would like to have a small store in her house.  She also would like to buy three cows and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, soil amendments, herbicide, and pesticide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dusan

texts.en:
Dusan wants to thank all of the lenders for his previous loan, which has helped him to purchase equipment for opening a new hair salon. He is very satisfied with the income and his business, and wants to thank all of the lenders. 

Now, for the second time, he is requesting a loan for his hair salon so that he can purchase new inventory. This loan will help him to have a more comfortable environment for his customers and updated tools to meet the changing demands and trends. He hopes that in the future he will be able to further expand his business. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Annancieta

texts.en:
Annancieta is married and has five children who are all at school.  She lives in her own house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites has a Sari-sari (general) store business while her husband works as a carpenter. The couple is earning a minimum of Php10, 000 a month which they spend on their five children and everyday household expenses such as food. This amount is not enough to support the education of their four children who are attending school. So Marites is requesting a loan amount of Php200, 000 from KIVA lenders to pay for college tuition fees for her daughter Marife, who plans to take up Accountancy. Marife is 16 years of age. She wants to finish college to have a profitable and stable job someday.  According to her, it is her dream to help her parents with their everyday expenses. Aside from this, she wants to provide her family with a better home. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will grant her mother's request.

loans.use: For her daughter Marife's college tuition fees.

loans.name: Elmer Omar

texts.es:
Elmer  de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta el bachillerato, esta soltero y no tiene hijos, vive junto con su madre.

Elmer aprendió a sembrar maíz a la edad de 12 años, ya que le ayudaba a su madre a realizar esta actividad, hoy siembra 7000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y siempre realiza las labores junto a su madre.



El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas. Elmer sueña con tener terreno propio donde sembrar y tener vacas. También sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elmer, 26, studied up to high school.  He's single and has no children.  He lives with his mother.

Elmer learned to grow corn when he was 12 years old because he helped his mother do that job.  Currently he cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn and always works with his mother.

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy corn seed, soil amendments, fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide.

Elmer dreams of having his own land to plant and of having cows.  He also dreams of improving his house.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, soil amendments, fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es:
Dora de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y tiene dos hijos. 
Dora trabaja desde que tiene uso de razón, ya que sus padres eran personas que les inculcaban el trabajo como una opción para la vida, hoy siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz junto a su esposo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra.   De esta forma Dora podrá darles los suplementos nutricionales adecuados al cultivo.

El sueño de Dora es  poder mejorar su vivienda, también desea tener muy buena salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Dora, 62, studied up to sixth grade.  She's married and has two children.  She earns a living in agriculture.

Dora has worked since she she was a child because her parents instilled in her the idea of work as an option in life.  Now she and her husband cultivate 10,500 square meters of corn.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy corn seed, fertilizer, soil amendments, herbicide, and pesticide, and to pay for labor.  That way she'll be able to give her crop the necessary nutritional supplements.

Dora's dream is to be able to improve her house.  She also wants to be very healthy so she can keep on working.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, soil amendments, herbicide, and pesticide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 33 years old and lives with her family in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Meri has a large family and lives with her parents-in-law (both of them are pensioners) and her two children (school-aged). Meri’s husband is in the Russian Federation and works and sends some money for his family’s needs. For the last five years, Meri also started to work and has become engaged in the clothes retail business. You can find a great assortment of fashionable clothes at her stall, and a separate place where she sells cosmetics and jewellery.  Since she has been in this business, their family's living conditions have improved a little bit and she is happy to help her husband to sustain their family's income. She works at the rented stall and brings her stall merchandise in a rented car from Yerevan city.

Meri needs this loan to buy a new assortment of merchandise for her stall to gain new customers and have good sales for this season.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise for her stall to gain new customers and have good sales for this season

loans.name: José Tomas

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en un taller de estructuras metálicas, desde hace más de treinta años, está casado por segunda vez , no tiene hijos y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, su nivel de estudio fue solo cuarto grado,  ya que por motivos de la guerra ya no pudo seguir estudiando y también que su familia era de bajos recursos económicos, el oficio lo aprendió  por su padre que le enseño a trabajar en lo que es la industria de hierro, su actividad la realiza en sus casa , ahí tiene los aparatos que utiliza para el trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar un aparato de soldadura, ya que es la herramienta principal para realizar su trabajo con lo cual ganara mejores ingresos para su familia, sus sueños es seguir trabajando para él y su esposa para tener mejores condiciones de vida y así ahorrarlo para cuando ya lleguen a la mayoría de edad no tengan que trabajar.
texts.en:
José, 56, has made a living working in a metal workshop for more than 30 years.  He's married for the second time.  He has no children and his wife is a homemaker.  He studied up to fourth grade; he wasn't able to continue because of the war and because his family had low financial resources.

He learned the trade from his father, who taught him metalwork.  He works in his house, where he has the equipment he uses in his job.

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy a welding machine.  It's the main tool for doing his job and with it he'll earn more income for his family.

His dreams are to keep on working so he and his wife have better living conditions and to save so they don't have to work when they get older.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She has higher economical education and now has her own clothes trading business. Armine’s husband, as the result of car accident, has became an invalid and is unable to work. So Armine is now the the only breadwinner in her family. Her son does his best to help Armine with her business, but the main part of the hardship is that Armine has to bare and solve the problems alone. Armine also has two little daughters to take care of, which she manages together with her business activities. In her own stall, she sells women and men's clothes, and her already loyal customers like the style and fashion of her sold merchandise very much. 

Armine is sure that if she receives this loan, it will greatly help her to have good sales and more income since this loan amount will help her to buy children's clothes and sports ware for teenagers.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes and sportsware for teenagers to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Şahizer

texts.en:
Şahizer is married and has a daughter.  She makes meerschaum jewellery which she sells at a stand.  With the loan from Maya, she will buy raw meerschaum to make her jewelry and increase her sales.  She makes the jewelry in the evenings at her house to sell at the stand.  Her goal is to open a workshop and store.  She wants to globalize and sell her products internationally.  She also wants a good future for her daughter. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Şahizer , evli bir kız çocuk annesi aileden gelen meslek lületaşını işleyerek takı haline getiriyor ve tezgahında satıyor .  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile lületaşını ham olarak aldı ve işleyerek satışlarını artırmak istiyor.  Evinin bir odasında akşamları işliyor ve tezgahta satıyor.  Hedefi atölye ve dükkan açmak.  Dünyaya açılmak ürünlerini pazarlamak istiyor.  Yedi yaşındaki kızına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy raw meerschaum to make her jewelry

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
To earn a living, Lina owns and operates a business that buys and sells beauty products. She has been successful in this business for years, and she has repaid her previous loan that she used for her business. She also finds ways to increase her income by maintaining her food vending business. *Lina appears here in a photo with her food vending items.

Lina would like to utilize a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of 15,000 PHP to buy more beauty products such as lotion, perfume, soap, and ladies' accessories that are necessary for her business.

She hopes to improve her business for many years to come. Lina dreams of providing an easier and happier life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise items such as beauty products and cosmetics necessary for her business.

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
AGRIPINA, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children.  One is at school and the other one is still small. She has been running a food shop for six years now.  She works from 06am to 09pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be AGRIPINA's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase her shop inventory.  She dreams of building her own house.

AGRIPINA will share this loan with her loan group "NZASA" which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on shop inventory.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti has operated a mat weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality but appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With this loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sewing materials and palm leaves for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and palm leaves for the business.

loans.name: İlknur

texts.en:
İlknur is a married mother of four children. She runs a meerschaum pipe shop with her husband, selling the special white stone that is mined. They buy unprocessed stone, and İlknur carves it in a workshop in their home. Her husband sells the merchandise in the shop. 

Tourism has grown in İlknur's city in recent years, and business has been good. With the loan, she will buy raw meerschaum to process and increase their sales. Her goals are to open a workshop and sell their products worldwide to create a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

İlknur,evli dört çocuk annesi eşiyle beraber lületaşı dükkanı işletiyor lüle taşını ham işlenmemiş olarak alıyor.  Evde bir odasını atölye haline getirerek çalışmalarına orada devam ediyor.  Dükkanda satışlarını eşi gerçekleştiriyor.  Yaşadığı şehir son yıllarda turizm de gelişme sağladığı için satışları iyi gitmeye başladı.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile lületaşını ham olarak aldı ve işleyerek satışlarını artırıyor.  Hedefleri var atölye açmak ve ürünlerini dunya ya satar hale gelmek çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak.

loans.use: to buy raw meerschaum to process in her workshop.

loans.name: 38 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tân has a retail business selling food (soft drinks, sweets, sugar, etc.). She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, sweets, and sugar to resell.

Tân is 65 years old, married, and has two children. Tân is the group leader of the 38 Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tân has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, sweets, and sugar to resell

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en:
Bintiomari is a married woman who has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics which will be transformed into clothes and resold and to purchase dry goods

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and for their personal, household, and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help support her family’s daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Ann dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other items to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food items to further expand his business.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
This is Haide, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Lito, a vendor, and they have children. With her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Haide operates a business selling men's and women's clothes and other similar products. She buys merchandise from wholesalers, and then sells the products for a small profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy ready-to-wear merchandise, like polo shirts for men and women, in order to expand her product inventory.

Haide hopes that her business will get bigger and dreams to have more customers. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear products to sell

loans.name: Al Taawoun Group

texts.en: Nadira is the featured representative of the Al Taawoun group. She and the other group members are best friends, who came together to apply for a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. Nadira is a 45-year-old married mother of five whose husband works in construction. She is Palestinian, and since refugees are limited to certain work in sectors, she has faced many difficulties in life. She quit school at the intermediate level, which further limits her working opportunities. Despite these obstacles, two years ago Nadira started renting out apartments to help cover the costs of sending her children to a private school. Nadira is a devoted mother who acquired her second loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to cover her daughter's wedding preparation fees. She hopes her financial situation will improve so that she can continue to provide her children with a better education. Nadira is the lovely woman wearing a blue veil, while Hiyam is on the left and her daughter, the bride—Rola, is in the middle of the photo.

loans.use: to  cover her daughter's wedding preparation fees.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, 41, is a married Ugandan woman with six children. She sells firewood, and she also sells milk to earn additional income. She had a lot of personal needs, which compelled her to start up a business, but she still faces challenges because of limited capital caused by low sales. Esther dreams of diversifying her business, if her sales increase such that she can have several sources of income. She needs a loan to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy  firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is married, and her three children are in college. One of her daughters will finish medical school in a year. She sells jewelry from a stand in a city market and has been slowly expanding her business. She has also learned to make jewelry, which she both makes and sells. With her second loan from Maya, she will produce jewelry to be marketed to the growing number of tourists. She is contributing to the economy of her family and country. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff. This Field Partner is allowed to choose to leave the local language description below the English one: 
Ayşe ,evli üc çocuk annesi çocukları üniversite okuyor. Bir kızı Tıpfakültesini bu yıl bitirecek . Ayşe Hanım bu ise küçük bir tezgahta takı satışı ile başlamış işini yavas yavaş büyütmüş . Takı yapımını da öğrenerek. Hem üretip hemde satış yapıyor. Bir çok semt pazarından yer alarak isini geliştirmis. Maya'dan aldığı ikinci kredi ile yaşadığı il son yıllarda turizm de gelişmeye başlayınca turiste yönelik takılar üreterek satıslarını gerçekleştiriyor. Aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs to make and sell jewelry.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda has been operating a general retail store for four years, and she earns enough to cover their living costs. Her previous loan, which was used in the business, was successfully repaid. The business is still doing well. To improve her inventory, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Clara

texts.es:
María Clara tiene 28 años de edad, vive al lado de su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico en el Caserío el Frayle, en una comunidad pequeña básicamente a la cría de animales menores, cliente se lleva bien con todos los miembros de su comunidad siendo colaborador y responsable en los actos requeridos, ubicada en el Distrito de Santo Tomás, a cinco horas de la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y comercialización de animales menores (patos, gallinas cuyes ), las que cría en el corral ubicado en su domicilio, desde varios años y lo comercializa los día domingos y jueves en el mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos pequeños que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mayor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Clara, 28, lives with her spouse and their two youngest children ages 4 and 2. She lives in her own home made of rustic materials in Caserío el Frayle, a small community dedicated to raising small livestock. She is doing well with all of the community members collaborating and taking responsibility for their tasks. The community is located in Santo Tomás district, five hours from the Cutervo Province that belongs to the Cajamarca region in northern Peru.

She makes a living raising and selling small animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. She raises them in a pen located at her home. For several years, she has sold on Sundays and Thursdays in her market's district.

She is requesting a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy small pigs that will allow her to sell them for a better price to her customers.

loans.use: to buy small pigs to fatten and sell at a better price.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro tiene 35 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres de material rustico, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en el Caserío Lishinas, una comunidad rural de clima variado en el Distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte público mediante una mototaxi , trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lázaro, age 35, lives in his parents’ house, which is made from basic materials.  He is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in the Lisbinas neighborhood, a rural community with a varied climate.  The inhabitants devote themselves to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He uses a ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle] to provide public transportation services.  He takes his passengers from surrounding areas to his district.  

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 soles to buy tires and for maintenance of his vehicle.  This way he will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy tires and for maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, a married woman, has three children, 13, 10 and 5. She operates a mobile money business in Kagadi, Uganda, to generate income. However, she faces a challenge of low net worth, which causes delays in providing service. Mary is hardworking and hopes to educate her children with retained earnings from her business. She is applying for a loan to expand her mobile money business by opening up another outlet.

loans.use: to expand her mobile money  business by opening up another outlet.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: John Bosco, who sells produce, is an honest married Ugandan man who earns additional income through farming, in order to support his family. He plans to grow his business despite the challenges of poor transport, which causes problems for him to refresh his stock in time. John Bosco intends to use the credit facility to buy more produce, especially maize, to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce, especially maize, to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and to passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable sellers, and she appreciates the support of the previous loan, which helped her to add to the stock of her business. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: El Hadji Mayoro

texts.fr: Monsieur Mayoro est un homme âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans la commercialisation des habits de prêt à porter pour femme. Il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans cette activité. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des habits prêts à porter pour femmes. Il quitte sa maison à 9 h pour y revenir vers les coûts de 20 h. A l’avenir, il souhaite avoir deux grandes boutiques de prêts à porter au marché. Il voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mayoro is a 45-year-old married man and father. He has gained a lot of experience in the retail of ready-to-wear women's clothes. He has over 10 years of experience in this field. He assumes responsibility for his family's daily expenses and his children's school fees. He is requesting this loan amount in order to purchase ready-to-wear women's clothing, which he will then resell. He leaves for work at 9 AM and returns home around 8 PM. In the future, he hopes to have two large ready-to-wear clothing stores at market. He would also like to increase his revenue and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear women's clothing, which he will then resell

loans.name: Nhóm 01, Thôn Trung Phú, Yên Mỹ Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hà works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to buy more chicks to raise and sell. Hà is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 01, Thôn Trung Phú, Yên Mỹ solidarity group. This is Hà’s first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is a lack of capital. In the future, Hà hopes that her business will do well and remain successful, and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando has been earning his living by planting and harvesting rice to sell for many years. Aside from farming, he also provides motor transportation services to the local community. He successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for tires and repairs. To improve his services, he took out a new loan recently to purchase motor accessories, such as rain protection. In the future, Armando wants to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy motor accessories, such as rain protection.

loans.name: Eudis Abigahil

texts.es:
Eudis de 35 años de edad, esta estudiando noveno grado porque  de soltera no tuvo mucha oportunidad de estudiar,  hoy de casada si, ella le gustaría estudiar y sacar una profesión, ella tiene dos hijos una estudia y el otro ya no quiere.

 Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también negocia con ropa desde hace unos 4 años,  y trabaja en la escuela cuidando los niños, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que deseos de trabajar le sobran, pero tiempo le falta.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ropa para revender, ya que dice es un buen negocio, a ella le gustaría que su hija fuera secretaria aunque también respeta su decisión.
texts.en:
Eudis, age 35, is going to school and is in the ninth grade.  She is doing this because when she was single she did not have a lot of opportunities to go to school.  She is now married, and she would like to continue her education and get a profession.  She has two children.  One of them goes to school, and the other one now does not want to.

She devotes herself to the household chores.  She also has had a business of selling clothes for four years.  She works at a school caring for children.  She is a very hard-working woman.  She has more than enough desire to work, but she lacks the time.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy clothes to resell.  She says that it is a good business.  

She would like for her daughter to become a secretary, but she will also respect her decision.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Bebian

texts.en:
Bebian sells fish in the local community in order to make a living. She has been vending fish for six years and it is still doing well. Her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. 

To improve sales, she took a new loan to buy more variety of fish to resell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Francisca hopes to expand soon and she dreams of success both in business and life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry tiene 24 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y una hija de 1 año y 7 meses de edad, es natural del Caserío el Frayle, una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas y patos), agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz amarillo duro, lo comercializa a los moradores de su caserío y los días domingos en el mercado del Distrito de Santo Tomás, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para cría y posteriormente ofrecerlo a sus clientes a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Henry is 24 years old. He has a stable home with his spouse and a daughter who is 1 year and 7 months old. He is a native of the village of El Frayle, a rural area in the Santo Tomás district. Its population works in agriculture, business, and ranching, and it is located in Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He grows small animals (guinea pigs, hens, and ducks) and farms, especially growing hard yellow corn. He sells it to the inhabitants of his village and on Sundays in the Santo Tomás district market. He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy small animals to raise and subsequently offer to his customers at a better price.

loans.use: to buy small animals to raise and fatten

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business but she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle spare parts and does farming. He is a 31-year-old married man and shrewd in business. He ventured into the above activities to generate income to support his family. Ronald plans to grow his business into new markets. Since Ronald has no threats to his business, he is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts for selling to meet market demands.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for selling

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a hardworking and enterprising woman who greatly thanks Kiva lenders for supporting her business. Mwaka wants to see her living standards improve as she takes care of her family and her child who is still underage.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more food ingredients such as maize flour, cooking oil, onions for her business.

She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients such as maize flour, cooking oil, onions for her business.

loans.name: Kasenyi Bataka Tukolere Hamu Group

texts.en:
Ambrose is a new client aged 40 years and a member of Kasenyi Bataka Tukolere Hamu Group. He is married with 6 children aged 13, 11, 9, 7, 5 and 2 years; 5 of them attend school at the moment. He is a fisherman but also has rentals where he earns additional income to meet his family needs. 

He has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy more fishing nets to help increase his catch. He started fishing in the year 2006 to earn income to support him and his family. He is a hard working man who works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week. He does fishing from Kasenyi landing site Kasese district and his customers are all categories of people especially fish traders around Kasenyi landing site.  

His future plan is to be financially stable and educate all his children. He is faced with a challenge of limited capital for his businesses but hopes to do well after getting the loan money and with future financial support this problem will soon be history. He appreciates the efforts of the Kiva lenders in trying to alleviate poverty.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 61 años de edad, de estado civil viudo, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz), vive en el Distrito de Buenos Aires a 40 minutos de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad de clima caluroso, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y comercio de plátano, lo comercializa en el mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Máximo is 61 years old. He is a widower, and he has public services (water and light). He lives in the district of Buenos Aires 40 minutes from Morropon, a community that works in agriculture, business, and ranching. It is a community with a hot climate in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

He raises cattle and sells bananas. He sells them in his district's market. He has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy manure to maintain his banana crop and in this way generate a larger income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure to maintain his banana crop

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María Jesús tiene 52 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus hijos, vive en Caserío El Frayle, una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y comercializacion de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas y patos),que los alimenta con granos naturales de la zona, junto con su esposo se dedican al cultivo de maíz amarillo duro.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de gallinas y cuyes para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio en los restaurants del distrito de Santo Tomás.
texts.en:
María Jesús is 52 years old. She has a stable home with her spouse and her children. She lives in the village of El Frayle, a rural area of the Santo Tomás district. Its population works in agriculture, business, and ranching, and it is located in Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals (guinea pigs, hens, and ducks), which she feeds with natural grains from the area. She and her husband grow hard yellow corn.

She has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy hens and guinea pigs in order to subsequently fatten them and offer them at a better price in the restaurants of the Santo Tomás district.

loans.use: to buy hens and guinea pigs in order to offer them at a better price

loans.name: José Erasmo

texts.es:
José  de 46 años de edad, es agricultor,  estudio hasta primer grado de básica y no continuo por la difícil situación económica o falta de voluntad, comenta que cuando él comenzaba a estudiar llegaron una personas y secuestraron los maestros y mas nunca llegaron maestros a esa escuela. Ellos tuvieron que huir pues era tiempo de guerra y después donde llegaron tuvieron que trabajar para comenzar de nuevo, ahora se dedica a la agricultura como siempre lo ha hecho.

Esta casado, su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos. El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono y aunque la tierra la tiene preparada con la esperanza que una vez mas se le de la oportunidad de trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, sus hijos estudian cuarto y quinto grado a él le gustaría que al menos uno de sus dos hijos fuera profesional, aunque a ellos les gusta hacer el trabaja que sus padre les enseña.
texts.en:
José, 46 years old, is a farmer. He studied through the first grade of primary school and did not continue due to the difficult economic situation or lack of will. He notes that when he started to study some people came and kidnapped the teachers and the teachers never came again to that school. They had to flee since it was wartime and afterward when they arrived they had to work in order to start again. Now he works in agriculture as he has always done. 

He is married and his wife works on the household duties. The loan he is requesting is to buy manure, although he has the land prepared with the hope that once more he will be given the opportunity to work in order to move his family ahead. His children study in the fourth and fifth grade. He would like for at least one of his two children to be a professional, although they like to do the work their father is teaching them.

loans.use: to buy manure

loans.name: Tony Osael

texts.es:
Tony de 19 años de edad, esta acompañado, estudio hasta noveno grado de básica y se dedica a la agricultura desde niño ya que el trabajo que sus padres hacían.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abonos y pesticidas para la milpa, ya que le gustaría que su hija que espera llegue a hacer doctora, agrego que pondrá su esfuerzo para que su hija lo logre.
texts.en:
Tony is 19 years old. He is in a relationship. He studied through the ninth grade of primary school and he has worked in agriculture since he was a child, since it was the work his parents did.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy manure and pesticides for the cornfield, since he would like the daughter he is expecting to become a doctor. He added that he will put his effort into his daughter achieving it.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides for the cornfield

loans.name: Gulbozor

texts.ru: Гулбозор родилась в 1964 году. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина из Таджикистана. Гулбозор замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Она 5 лет назад начала свой бизнес выращиванием хлопка и пшеницы. Гулбозор выращивает культуры на собственной земле. Ее муж тоже занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Он помогает Гулбозору по введению бизнеса. Гулбозор должна купить минеральные удобрения для земли, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbozor was born in 1964 and is a conscientious and hardworking woman from Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Five years ago she started a business growing cotton and wheat. She grows crops on her own land with help from her husband. Gulbozor needs to buy mineral fertilizers for her land but does not have enough money. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy the fertilizers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge e hijos, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayalti y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con el apoyo de su esposa atienden en su bodeguita ubicada en su domicilio, en un corral que tienen en la parte posterior de su vivienda crían animales menores como gallinas y cuyes.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Raúl is 49 years old. He lives with his spouse and children in a small community in the rural area of Cayalti. He has good personal and work references from his neighbors, who work in agriculture, business, and ranching. The community is located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He sells groceries. His wife helps him look after their little grocery store located in their home. They raise small animals such as hens and guinea pigs in a pen that they have in the back part of their house.

He has asked for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy a variety of groceries to stock his business and offer to his customers, generating a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries to stock his little grocery store

loans.name: Cesar Jose

texts.es:
Cesar José tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto con sus hijos en el Distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 501 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar al por mayor ladrillos para ofrecerlo a un mejor precio, lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar José is 43 and lives with his children in a town in Oyotún District. Oyotún is in Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru. The climate in this area is temperate, and most people make their living managing small businesses, farms, or ranches.  

Cesar José has for over five years worked making bricks at his home and using his own tools and equipment. He has applied for a loan of 2,501 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, and plans to purchase wholesale bricks. Cesar José will then be able to sell the bricks at a more competitive price, earning higher income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale bricks.

loans.name: Alex Antonio

texts.es: Alex se dedica a la comercialización de calzados diversos, de forma ambulante. Alex tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica a la educación de sus hijos y al cuido del hogar. Alex esta solicitando el crédito para invertir en zapatos de damas y niñas, y variar la oferta hacia sus clientes, además con esto atenderá también diversas solicitudes de sus clientes al tener los estilos que más buscan. Sus planes son siempre los mismos, poder establecerse en un tramo de un mercado de la ciudad, y para eso trabaja arduamente día a día.
texts.en:
Alex makes a living by selling a variety of shoes in an itinerant fashion. He is 39 years old, is married and has two young children. His wife is a housewife; she dedicates herself to the education of their children and to caring for the home.

Alex is asking for the loan to invest in shoes for women and children and to vary what he offers his customers. He will also attend to various requests from his customers to have the styles they are most looking for.

His plans are always the same: to be able to establish an area of his own in the city's market and to work arduously for this day after day.

loans.use: to buy shoes for women and girls

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase used clothing and corn

loans.name: Marina Concepción

texts.es:
Marina de 43 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, esta acompañada tiene dos hijos, ella solo estudio hasta sexto grado y no fue porque no tuviera la oportunidad sino que no quiso estudiar aunque ahora dice le hubiera gustado estudiar, tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian esta acompañada su compañero de vida es jornalero, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hermanos de los Estados Unidos le apoyan en lo económico.

También ella elabora tamales u otro tipo de merienda para generar ingresos. Ella necesita el dinero para construir una pequeña vivienda, tendría que comprar lamina y madera para hacer su casa, ya en la mano de obra también le aportaría su compañero de vida, a ella le gustaría darles el estudio a sus hijos pero respeta lo que ellos decidan siempre y cuando sea una actividad productiva.
texts.en:
Marina, 43 years old, takes care of her home. She is in a relationship and has two children. She only studied through sixth grade and it was not because she did not have the opportunity but that she wouldn't study, although now she says she would have liked to study. She has two children, who are in school. She is in a relationship. Her partner is a day laborer. She takes care of her home. Her brothers in the United States help her financially.

She also makes tamales or another kind of snack to generate income. She needs the money to build a little house. She would have to buy sheets of metal and wood to build her house, since her partner will also provide her with the labor. She would like to give her children an education, but she respects what they decide, provided that it is a productive activity.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and wood to build her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes and corn

loans.name: Deyanira De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Deyanira habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, Casada madre de dos niños en edades escolares, sus esposo le apoya incondicionalmente, el es conductor de una Moto taxi y ella es Asesora de Belleza y trabaja a domicilio, solicita el crédito para realizar mejoras en sus vivienda comprara Materiales de Construcción como Zinc, cemento, clavos, arena, piedrin, perlines para componer parte del techo de su vivienda, agradece el apoyo que Kiva en conjunto a Afodenic le están brindando con este crédito.
texts.en: Deyanira lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is married and the mother of two school-aged children. Her husband supports her unconditionally. He is a motorcycle taxi driver.  She works as a beauty consultant from her home. She is requesting a loan to make some improvements on her house. She will buy construction materials like zinc laminate, cement, nails, sand, gravel and rafters to repair part of the roof of her house. She is grateful for the support from Kiva in conjunction with Afodenic who are providing her this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mario Francisco

texts.es: El señor Mario continua con su negocio que gracias a su esfuerzo a salido adelante y sus ganancias las invierte en la construcción de su vivienda, el solicita es financiamiento para la compra de Abarrotes como, arroz, frijoles, aceite, maíz, azúcar, carnes, refrescos, etc, su negocio es una pulperia que gracias a la afluencia de  clientes a aumentado al mayor, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado en estos años por que su estabilidad familiar a mejorado.
texts.en: Mario continues with his business. Thanks to his effort he has moved ahead and is investing his earnings in the construction of his house. He is asking for the loan to buy groceries such as rice, beans, oil, corn, sugar, meat, soft drinks, etc. His business is a small grocery store that has grown larger thanks to the influx of customers. He is thankful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have provided him during these years because his family stability has improved.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase staple foods and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase staple foods

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, who operates a boutique and a farm, is married and hardworking and lives in Kagadi Uganda. He desires to grow his business despite the challenges of thieves in the locality who break into his shop and steal. However, John is a hardworking man who is asking for a loan to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
Ana es una señora de 38 años de edad,  sus padres se dedicaban a la agricultura y no contaban con el dinero suficiente para que Ana pudieran seguir estudiando,  su esposo de dedica a sembrar hortaliza en invernaderos juntos desarrollan los trabajos en los cultivos y en los tiempos libres sus hijos cuando no van a la escuela les apoyan en las actividades que hacen en los cultivos.

Ana se dedica a la venta y comercialización de frutas y verduras, comenta que desde que estaba pequeña se dedica a la venta de verduras y que es una actividad que le genera ingresos para ella y su familia; es una actividad que sus padres también realizan, pues ellos la cultivan y lo venden en los mercados,  por la mañana y por la tarde realizan las venta junto a sus hijos cuando ellos tienen tiempo libre y no van a a la escuela la apoyan para movilizarse con la mercadería, vende en los mercados aledaños a su pueblo, no tiene un lugar estable pues trabajan con pedidos que sus clientes le piden de frutas y verduras.

Ana utilizará el préstamo para invertirlo en ampliar más su negocio, específicamente comprara  más verduras y frutas esto para ofrecer un mejor servicio y  tener más variedad para sus clientes y obtener más ganancias para su negocio, era un necesidad que tenia de adquirir el crédito y poder comprar más verduras y frutas para la venta.

Ella siempre ha querido ampliar más sus ventas,  tener su propio lugar de ventas que le facilite su trabajo y no tener que salir a vender, también que su esposo logre expandir sus cultivos para una mayor producción,  también desea seguir dándoles a sus hijos el estudio para que el futuro sean personas de bien en la sociedad y por otra parte poder remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and the daughter of farmers who lacked the money that would have allowed her to continue attending school. Ana sells fruits and vegetables, and her husband grows crops in greenhouses. Ana helps her husband care for his crops, as do the couple's children when they are not in school and have free time. 

Ana says that she's sold produce since she was a girl, and her parents still grow crops and sell them at markets. Ana doesn't have a fixed location, and works in markets near her town, also taking orders from customers. Ana sells at markets in the mornings and afternoons, earning an income to help her family. When her children aren't in school, they help their mother prepare to work. 

Ana will use the funds from this loan to invest in and expand her business, purchasing more fruits and vegetables. This additional inventory will allow her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and earn more income for the business. Lacking the capital for these investments, Ana requires a loan. 

Ana has always wanted to boost her sales and have her own location, which would simplify her work as she wouldn't have to travel to markets in order to sell her produce. Ana also hopes that her husband can expand his crops and achieve a bigger harvest. She also aspires to keep paying for her children's education so that they'll be productive members of society and be able to renovate the family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a twenty-four-year-old married woman with one child who lives in Kasese, Uganda. After realizing that her husband could not meet all of the family's needs with his limited income, she decided to set up a shoe business. Like everyone in this business, Racheal faces a challenge of price fluctuations. Her dream is to trade on a wholesale basis. She intends to use the loan to buy shoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy shoes for selling.

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
José de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, es soltero y actualmente vive con su abuela.

José es agricultor trabajo que realiza desde muy pequeño, cultivando una 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, además él se dedica también a la siembra de sandía, tiene otra fuentes de ingreso; ya que posee un vehículo con el cual realiza viajes ya sea a la ciudad o a cantones vecinos ya que en esta localidad no hay trasporte público, sus trabajos en la agricultura los realiza de 6:00 de la mañana a 12:00 del mediodía, el lugar donde cultiva de su casa está a una distancia de 25 minutos caminando.

El dinero será utilizado para la cancelación del alquiler del terreno, compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas y en cancelación de las personas que le ayudaran a realizar los trabajos.

Su principal sueño es construir su propia  casa, formar su propia familia y seguir trabajando para superarse cada día más y cumplir con los compromisos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
José is 31 years and studied up to the fifth grade in the local community school. He is single and currently lives with his grandmother. José is a farmer, work he has done since he was very young, cultivating 10,500 square meters of corn. He also makes a living by planting watermelon. He has another source of income, as he has a vehicle he uses for transport to the city or to neighboring cantons since there's no public transport in his area. He does his agricultural work from 6:00 in the morning to 12:00 noon. The place where he farms is a 25-minute walk from his house.

The money will be used to pay the rent on his land, to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to pay the people who help him do his work.

His primary dreams are to build his own house, to start his own family, to keep working to overcome more obstacles each day, and to follow through with the commitments he has made.

loans.use: to pay the rent on his land, to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to pay the people who help him do his work.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno vive con ella. Actualmente junto con ella vive un nieto que ella tiene desde pequeño, el joven trabaja como peluquero.

Enma se dedica a los trabajos domésticos, pero su nieto se dedica también a trabajar en la agricultura, sembrando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que les provee los suficientes granos para el sustento de ellos dos y para vender parte de la cosecha.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para cancelar el arrendamiento del terreno donde cultiva, compra de herbicidas y fertilizantes que le permitan obtener una buena cosecha esta temporada.

EL sueño de Enma es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando, además que esta cosecha sea buena para hacer frente a todos los compromisos obtenidos y brindarle un buen ejemplo a su nieto de responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Enma is 67 years old and studied up to grade 4. She has 3 children, none of whom live with her. A grandchild does live with her that she has had since he was small. He works as a hairdresser. Enma works doing domestic chores and her grandson also farms, growing 7,000 sq. meters of corn. This provides plenty of food for them and they sell part of the harvest.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to pay for the lease of the land that they cultivate and to buy herbicides and fertilizer in order to obtain a good harvest this season. Enma's dream is to enjoy good health so that she can continue working. She also wants a good harvest so she can take care of all the obligations that she has and give her grandchild a good example of being responsible.

loans.use: to pay for the lease on the land she cultivates and to buy herbicides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and ceramic tile, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Nelmalita

texts.en:
Nelmalita previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nelmalita hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  There she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: Joachim is a twenty-eight-year-old man, married with three children and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa. Besides that he decided to start up a retail shop to meet his family's basic needs. He dreams of expanding his business to a big selling center, but competition and insufficient funds hinder his progress. He is a very hardworking man who wants a loan to buy phone spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy phone spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Shamila

texts.en: Shamila is a twenty-seven-year-old female who is married with five children and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa for selling, and the proceeds help her to cover her family's basic needs. She dreams of buying land to plant cocoa so that she could yield more cocoa for selling. She is a very hardworking woman, though seasonality affects her production. Shamila will use the loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Martin

texts.es: El señor Segundo Martín, continua con sus planes de tener su casa propia, trabaja como Analista en una Institución y su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia, el crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de Zinc, perlines, cerámica ya que con mucho esfuerzo a ido levantándola poco a poco, muy agradecido con Kiva y Afodenic por el apoyo que se  le ha brindado estos años.
texts.en:
Mr. Segundo Martín continues with his plans of having his own house. He works as an analyst in an institution, and his biggest dream is having a house of his own. 

The loan he’s requesting is to buy zinc, perlins, and ceramic. With a lot of effort, he has kept building his house gradually. He is very thankful to Kiva and Afodenic for all the support they have given him in the last years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Somaria Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Somaria Concepción, es madre de 2 hijos pequeños y se dedica al comercio desde hace 18 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de celulares y barbería en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela desde las 06:00 am y finalizándolas a las 06:00 pm con el mismo horario de lunes a domingo, ella realiza esta labor para la mantención de sus hijos.   

Doña Somaria, solicito a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo para la compra de productos tales como: zapatos, sandalias, reproductores, memorias, entre otros artículos; así lograr mayores ventas incrementando su inventario con calzado y celulares al igual con productos de mayor calidad lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos al igual que un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Somaria Concepción is the mother of 2 small children and she has worked in business for 18 years. Her current business is selling cell phones and a barber shop in one of the markets in the city of León. She starts selling to her customers at 6:00 a.m. and finishes at 6:00 p.m., with the same schedule Monday through Sunday. She does this work to support her children.

Somaria is asking for a loan from Ceprodel that she will use to buy products such as shoes, sandals, disc players, and memory cards, among other items. In this way, she will achieve higher sales, increasing her inventory with shoes and cell phones as well as with products of higher quality, which will allow her to obtain a larger income as well as a better standard of living with her small children.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, disc players, memory cards, etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Sơn Đồng, Yên Mỹ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Nguyệt is 51 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 03 thôn Sơn Đồng, Yên Mỹ solidarity group. 

In 2012, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nguyệt hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Faisi

texts.en:
Faisi is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with three children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

She deals in the cocoa business which has assisted her to fulfill her family's basic requirements. She needs a loan to buy more cocoa to sell and dreams of buying cocoa land to harvest more yields, though seasonality and insufficient funds affect her business. 

Faisi is working hard to expand her business to a big cocoa store.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lydia is a new client who has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings) to buy foodstuffs for her hotel business. She is married with three children aged 10, 6 and 1 year, two of whom attend school at the moment. She is a hardworking lady who works 12 hours a day and 7 days a week. 

She started a restaurant in 2009 to have an income to look after her family. She is from Bugongi town, Sheema South, Sheema District, and her clients are all categories of people. She is faced with the challenge of competition from fellow hotel businesspeople but is determined to beat the competition through her hard work. Her hopes for the future are to be financially stable and achieve all her dreams while given the loan money.

loans.use: To buy food.

loans.name: Walter Yonis

texts.es:
Walter de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta el bachillerato general, está casado y ella trabaja como sastre, tienen 3 hijas, una 19 años que estudio hasta el bachillerato, también otra de 15 años y otra de 14 años.

Walter se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura labor que aprendió de su padre desde quera pequeño, pero también tiene otra fuentes de ingresos, ya que él trabaja de 6:00 de la mañana a 10:00 de la mañana como cargador y descargador de lanchas en el muelle, también trabaja como ministro en una iglesia evangélica, además su esposa ayuda con los ingresos de la familia ya que ella junto con su hija mayor confeccionan los uniformes de los estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad  
          
El dinero del crédito será utilizado para los trabajos en la agricultura, ya que tiene que contratar a otras personas que le ayuden a la siembra del maíz y realizar las compras de herbicidas y fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha y hacer frente a las responsabilidades que ha adquirido.

Sus planes a futuro es seguir trabajando y servirle a Dios en el ministerio que le ha confiado y trabajar duramente para brindarle los estudios superiores sus hijas.
texts.en:
Walter is 36 years old, studied up to high school and is married. His wife works as a tailor and they have three daughters, a 19-year-old who studied up to high school and two other girls ages 15 and 14.

Walter makes a living by doing agricultural work, which he learned from his father from the time he was young. But he also has other sources of income, as he works as a loader and unloader of boats at the dock from 6:00 to 10:00 in the morning. He also works as a minister at an Evangelical church.
