texts.en: Christine is a 22-year-old business lady living in Gokwe North District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a kapenta project (dried sardines) for a year now. To give back to her community Christine volunteers as a Learner Guide teaching life skills to students at her former school. With the requested Kiva loan, Christine intends to purchase more kapenta directly from nearby fisheries. With the excess profits she hopes to help her family meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more dried sardines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarette, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Justice

texts.en:
Justice is a thirty-year-old hard working single woman with two children who lives in Kamwenge-Uganda. 

Her main business is raising cattle and selling of milk.  She also grows bananas. She started this business to increase on her income and look after her two children.  Her business challenges including dealing with the diseases that attack her animals and fluctuating prices. However she would like to educate her children. 

She requests a loan to buy cows to produce more milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to produce more milk to sell.

loans.name: Evarist

texts.en: Evarist is a forty-one-year-old hardworking married man with four children, living in Kamwenge-Uganda. He deals in produce, selling maize and coffee as his main source of income. He also practices farming where he earns an extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and have better standards of living. He faces a challenge of weather changes that affect his produce business and lack of capital to meet the increasing demands. He has a vision of owning a big modern store, selling produce. Evarist is requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, and seasonings.

loans.name: Fadziso

texts.en:
Fadziso is a 25-year-old mother of two who lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. 

She has raised broiler chickens for four months and her business produces batches of 50 broiler chickens every 6 weeks.  She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into business so that she could look after herself and break the cycle of poverty in her family. 

During her spare time, Fadziso volunteers by cleaning school yards within her community. With the requested loan, Fadziso plans to buy more chicks, feed, and vaccines to expand her business.  This would allow her to increase her production capacity to 100 birds every 6 weeks.  This would result in an increase in sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is an 18-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe.  She has sold clothes for four months and was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into business so that she could financially assist her parents. 

During her spare time, Jane volunteers as a Learner Guide instructing wellbeing sessions at local secondary schools. With the requested loan, Jane plans to buy clothing to sell and improve her sales and profits. With improved profits, she plans to re-enroll in classes at school.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Muhwezi

texts.en: Muhwezi is a 28-year-old, single man, with one child aged four, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle (boda boda) transportation as his main source of income, though he earns an extra income from farming. He started this business to look after his child. He faces a challenge of many accidents that occur on the roads, and price fluctuation of fuel. He has a vision of becoming a prominent businessman.  Muhwezi is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy kitchen utensils, maize and beans

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 37, married and the father of two children, ages four and nine years old. He is employed in a call center but earns a low salary. After his normal work hours, he works on his land with his wife, growing different vegetables to sell and to use at home. 

Mustafa is now in need of a loan to purchase materials to build another greenhouse. He hopes, with this addition to his agricultural business, he will be able to generate more income and further expand his business. 

His goal is to give his children a better education and a better future. He knows that this is a Kiva loan and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build another greenhouse

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is an 18-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothes to all age groups for six months now. When she is not working at her business, Juliet serves as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member, volunteering to work at schools within the community. 

With the requested loan, she intends to make bulk purchases of clothing to boost her sales and profits. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a large retail business and create employment for people in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing to boost her sales and profits.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, 28 years old, is a divorced mother of a 14 year-old son. Although she works as a nurse in a clinic, live is hard for her because she raises her son on her own. 

In the past, she lived in a very old and small house in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. However, thanks to one of the humanitarian organizations, a new home was built for her. She feels very lucky and is very happy that she has been able to improve her living conditions.  She has still not managed to complete the insulation on the outside of the home. She requests her first loan to renovate the house. This loan will help her to something that she could not afford to do on her own.

 She is very grateful for the opportunity provided by the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a hard working married man with six children who are 16, 14, 10, 6 and 4 years old .  They live in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He grows coffee and bananas as his main source of income.  He also uses his motorcycle (boda boda) to earn extra income. He started this business to educate his children. His business is affected by seasonal demands for his products. He has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer and educating his children. 

He requests a loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 19-year-old, entrepreneur living in Gokwe North, a district in northern Zimbabwe near the border of Zambia. She operates a grocery shop from her parents’ home, selling groceries like sugar, cooking oil, rice, washing powder and other grocery items. She started the business in order to become financially independent. To give back to her community, Esther volunteers as a Learner Guide at her local secondary school where she teaches students life skills education. With the requested Kiva loan, Esther plans to restock and improve her business in order to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more movies  to sell.

loans.name: Blerim

texts.en:
Blerim is a 24-year-old married father with one daughter. He lives with his family in a small village in Kosovo and earns his living working in a car wash.  He works very hard from early in the morning until late at night, but earns a low salary. It was often difficult for Blerim to get to and from work as his work hours are not always within the bus' schedule. 

He has managed to buy a car but needs registration money so he can start driving the car to work. He asks for this first loan to register the car and make some general repairs. His goal is to open his own car wash in the future and give his child a better education. 

He wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to register the car and do general repairs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 50, is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in selling secondhand clothes in open markets as his main source of income, alongside farming. 

He was inspired to start this business to increase his income and have a better living. He faces challenges of competition, seasonal customers and weather changes that stop customers from turning up, but he has hopes for the future. 

Charles is requesting a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soaps and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy "Tchoukoutou" (a local beverage) and various other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing products

loans.name: Naume

texts.en: Naume is a 20-year-old, businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothing, purses, and plastic sandals for four months. When she is not working at her business, Naume serves as a Cama (a network of graduates) member volunteering to work in local schools. With the requested Kiva loan, Naume intends to make bulk purchases of clothes to boost her sales and profits. With those additional profits she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment within her community, and provide for her siblings.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothes to boost her sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and charcoal.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is a 31-year-old businesswoman. She is single and has one child, whom she lives with in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been practicing hairdressing for a year and a half and would like to expand her business.  

She was encouraged by her sister and other Cama (a network of graduates) members to venture into entrepreneurship so that she could look after herself and her child. In her spare time, she volunteers at a local school by assisting with cleaning toilets and general upkeep. 

With this requested loan, Joana intends to buy more hair relaxers, rollers, blowers and hair extensions to offer more to her clients and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es:
Los pasos de toda madre son importantes para los hijos, pues son su modelo a seguir. Ese es el caso de Ángela de 31 años, quien desde pequeña apoyaba a su madre en cada negocio donde ella laboraba. No obstante, esta futura Lic. de Administración de empresa, decidió cortar el cordón umbilical en los negocios con su madre y emprendió en su propio negocio de venta de comida y jugos, con el apoyo económico de su esposo y la motivación de sus tres hijos de 10, 7 años y uno de 6 meses de edad. 
Ahora es su mamá quien la apoya cuando puede en su negocio. Ángela, con una esplendorosa sonrisa cuenta sus expectativas positivas sobre su negocio, el cual seguirá creciendo con el apoyo de un préstamo para comprar frescos, jugos, repostería, entre otros productos, que son de mayor demanda en su negocio. Gracias a este préstamo sabe que diversificará sus productos, tendrá más cantidades y de buena calidad. Entre sus metas está concluir con su carrera, seguir aportando en su negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Every mother's steps are important for her children, because they serve as a model. That is the case with Angela, age 31, who since she was little has helped her mother in every one of her mother's businesses. However, this future Business Administration graduate decided not to continue in her mother's businesses. Instead, with financial support from her husband and motivation from her three children, ages 10, 7 and six months, she started her own business selling food and juices. Now it's her mother who helps her in her business when she can.

Angela, with a magnificent smile, describes the positive prospects for her business, which she hopes to continue growing with the help of a loan to buy soft drinks, juices and baked goods, as these are the products that are most in demand. Thanks to this loan, she knows that she will be able to diversify and improve the quality of her products, as well as hold larger quantities in inventory. Among her goals are finishing her university degree and continuing to invest in her business so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices and baked goods for her business.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Isidro está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que quiere aprender, para que por medio de los préstamos vayan invirtiendo en las actividades de cada una para mejorar sus vidas.
Gabriela tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene muy buena clientela que va a comprar de ella. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que se fue abriendo camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, etc., de manera a seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The group named “San Isidro” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. This is a new group that is eager to learn and the loans will be invested in the businesses of each of the members so that they can improve their lives.

Gabriela has a food pantry where she works every day, starting in the early morning hours. She has a good clientele who always buy from her. Gabriela says that she started out with very little, but it has allowed her to make headway.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, and other products. This will enable her to keep offering a wide variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a forty-five-year-old hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, selling maize, ground nuts and coffee as his main source of income though he also practices agriculture where he earns an extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and educate his children. 

He faces a challenge of weather and seasonal changes that affect his produce business and lack of capital to meet the increasing demands. He has a vision of expanding his business.

Henry will use the loan to buy more maize, ground nuts and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, ground nuts and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.ru: Бибинисо верная жена и мама двухлетнего ребенка. Ей 25 лет. Она с мужем и ребенком живет в Шахритусе.  Бибинисо дома занимается куплей и продажей скотин. В работе ей помогает муж и во всем ее поддерживает. Бибинисо более двух лет занимается откормом скотин и считает, что набралась достаточного опыта работы в сфере животноводства чтобы расширить бизнес. Она надеется получить кредит и купить скотин для дальнейшей купли и продажи.
texts.en: Bibiniso is a faithful wife and the mother of a two-year-old.  She is 25, married, and lives with her husband and child in Shahrituz.  Bibiniso works from home raising and dealing in cattle, and has been doing so for more than two years.  Her husband helps her tend to their animals and is always there for her when she needs him.  She feels she has enough experience raising livestock to start expanding her business, and is seeking a loan to buy more cattle to fatten and eventually resell.

loans.use: buy cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana es una joven emprendedora, tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un pequeño hijo y vive en Imperial junto a su familia. Al ser madre soltera tuvo que buscar la manera de salir adelante sola y lo logró. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida (salchipapa, broaster, etc) y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora, y sobre todo porque ofrece comida de calidad y es muy amable con los clientes.
Ana está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mesas y sillas para brindar comodidad a sus clientes y puedan disfrutar mejor sus comidas. De esta manera se incrementará el número de clientes con lo que ella obtendrá más ganancias y más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio restaurante".
texts.en:
Ana is a young entrepreneur who is 22 years old. She is a single mother and has a young son. Ana lives with her family in Imperial. Being a single mother, she had to look for ways to move forward on her own and has succeeded. She currently sells food such as sausages and potatoes, roasted chicken, and other dishes. Ana is doing very well because she is a responsible and hardworking person. Most of all, she offers quality food and is very friendly with her customers.

Ana is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have provided. She will buy tables and chairs so that her customers will be comfortable and be able to better enjoy their food. Ana hopes this will increase the number of customers so that she can generate more income. Going forward, she will be able to fulfill her greatest wish of having her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her food business.

loans.name: San Pedro Pablo Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Pedro Pablo está en su ciclo número 9º donde cada una de ellas se dedica a sus respectivas actividades, todas ellas trabajan y se esmeran en trabajar ya que son el sostén del día a día en sus casas.
Liz es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer manicura, gracias al buen trabajo que hace, ya se hizo conocida en el barrio, y se formó una muy buena clientela. Su deseo siempre fue el de poder tener su propio salón de belleza, y es por esa meta que está luchando día a día.
Liz en pos a seguir con su trabajo pide este préstamo, ya que quiere comprar esmaltes, limas, alicates, algodón, acetonas y otros productos que necesita para poder seguir con su trabajo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que tiene y que le permitirá seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Pablo group is in its ninth loan cycle. All of the members work very hard at their respective businesses because they are working to meet their families' day-to-day needs.

Liz is part of this group. She works as a manicurist. Because of the high quality of her work, she has already made a name for herself in her neighborhood and has an established clientele. She has always wanted to have her own beauty salon, and it is for this goal that she works every day.

To continue with her business, Liz is requesting this loan to buy nail polish, nail files, nail clippers, cotton, nail polish remover and other products she uses in her business. She is grateful for this opportunity to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail files, nail clippers, cotton, nail polish remover and other products she uses in her business.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty Kyrey está en su ciclo número 11, además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, a través del cual quieren conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Rumilda es una persona digna de destacar, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, lo que quiere decir que está en un nivel medio. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras que hace en forma ambulante, y a través de la cual tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora que pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con gran cantidad de productos, ya que quiere comprar tomates, locotes, cebollas, y otros, de manera a seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Aty Kyrey" is in its 11th loan cycle.  They are also participating in the Poverty Elimination Survey, which is how they will come to understand each individual's financial situation and according to this, how to proceed to work with each other.

Rumilda is a remarkable woman.  In the last survey she was found to be at level two, which is to say that she was at a medium level of poverty.  She has a business selling vegetables in an itinerant manner, and through this means she helps her family.  She is a person who sacrifices and struggles, and she is requesting this loan to stock up her business with a large quantity of products.  She wants to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, and other products.  In this way, she will continue with her sales as she has been doing, and will strive to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Louisa

texts.en: Louisa is a 21-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi district of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothing and hair extensions for three months now. She was encouraged by other Cama members (Camfed’s alumni network) to venture into business so that she would be able to look after herself financially. In her spare time, Louisa assists the mother support group by preparing food for the school feeding program. With the requested loan, Louisa plans to buy more clothing and hair extensions to increase her stock. She plans to provide for herself and assist in paying school fees for her siblings with the additional profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and hair extensions to increase her stock

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the selling of second hand clothes as his main source of income alongside agriculture. He started this business to earn a living and take care of his family. 

He faces a number of challenges including competition from his colleagues, high taxing of products and price fluctuations. Jackson has hopes of owning a wholesale boutique.

He is requesting a loan to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is a 23-year-old single mother of one living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothing for five months. When she is not working in her business Nyasha serves as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member by volunteering as a Community Health Trainer, disseminating health information to schools within her village. 

With the requested loan Nyasha intends to make bulk purchases of clothing which will allow her to increase her profitability. With those additional profits she hopes to expand into a retail shop, create employment within her community and provide for her child.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing which will allow her to increase her profitability.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings, manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crates of soda to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 24-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling school shoes for eight months now. Pamela was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into her business so that she could become financially independent. In her spare time, she volunteers as a Learner Guide delivering Better World sessions to students in schools. With the requested loan from Kiva, Pamela plans to purchase more shoes for all ages. With the additional profits, she intends to better provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 70-year-old hardworking married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle rearing and selling milk. He started this business to increase his income and look after his family.  He has hardships of competition, theft of his cows and dry seasons that affect his expected returns. However, his vision is to increase the size of his farm, which will in turn increase sales and profits. 

Sam has asked for a loan to buy more cows for his farm to produce milk.

loans.use: to buy more cows to produce milk to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Librada está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan tienen sus actividades que se basan en su mayoría en el macate y en la artesanía. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Romina, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta vende de forma ambulante todo tipo de productos, como jabón, leche, galletitas y demás, y también se dedica a elaborar artículos artesanales.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar como jabón, leche, galletitas y demás y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Agradecen todas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group Santa Librada is in its second loan cycle in the program of women's committees where everyone works. The majority have jobs as street vendors or in handicrafts. They are doing the poverty elimination inventory and three find themselves below the poverty line.

One of the members is Romina, who among the work she does, is working as a street vendor, selling all sorts of products such as soap, milk, cookies and other things, and she also makes handicrafts.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase soap, milk, cookies and other supplies and in this way continue with her sales as she has been doing, which will be a great help to her.  They are all grateful for this opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, cookies and other things.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio es un joven con muchas aspiraciones de salir adelante para así poder llegar a ser un buen profesional.
Una de sus metas es obtener su titulo universitario de contador, ejercer su profesión y ayudar a sus padres.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que así podrá cubrir ese gasto y seguir estudiando y luchando por cumplir su meta de ser un profesional exitoso.
El es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y que quiere ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Arsenio is a young man with many aspirations to succeed and to become a good professional.  One of his goals is to get his college degree in accounting, exercise his skills and help his parents.

He is asking for this loan to invest in paying his tuition.  The loan will cover this expense and enable him to keep studying and struggling to meet his goal of being a successful professional.

He is a person who is striving to get ahead and wants to be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 59-year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming where he grows bananas as his main source of income, although he also carries out cattle grazing to earn extra income. He started this business to look after his family. He faces a challenge of seasonal markets for his products. He has a vision of owning a modernized farm and educating his children to higher levels of education. 

He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anatoria

texts.en:
Anatoria is a 21-year-old businesswoman from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. As a single mother of one, Anatoria works hard to provide for her family. To do this, she operates a business at the local center selling blankets, shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets. She really loves her shop and would like to increase her sales in order to expand it. 

Anatoria is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes jackets and blankets to increase her stock. She will use the proceeds to improve her standard of living, expand the business and create employment in her community. To give back to her community in her spare time, Anatoria volunteers in schools helping students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle rearing alongside farming. He started this business to increase his income and pay school fees for his children, since he himself is not educated.  He has hardships of inadequate capital and price fluctuations. However, he has a vision of educating his children to university.
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Renacer, tiene 21 integrantes, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá, a través de las capacitaciones poder superar su línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zunilda, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, donde a través del trabajo que ella hace en la venta de bijouteries poder superar la pobreza. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer bijouterie, como canutillos, hilos, pinzas y demás,  para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This is the group called “Renacer” (To Be Reborn), which has 21 members. All of them have consented to taking the poverty elimination survey. Through the training they receive, they will be able to rise above the poverty line.

One of the members is Sra. Zunilda. Her latest survey indicated that she was at a Stage 2 poverty level. Through her work of selling trinkets, she is able to overcome poverty. Zunilda is a hardworking individual, but most of all, she is determined.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for making trinkets. These include miniature tubes, thread, tweezers, and other supplies for making products to sell. This will help to solidify her business plan and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy miniature tubes, thread, tweezers, and other supplies for making trinkets.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Agronegocios, lo cual le permitirá poder abrirse camino en el mundo laboral.
Ella está luchando para poder cumplir su meta de ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por cumplir su meta.
texts.en: Karen is doing her university degree in Agribusiness, which will give her opportunities in the labor market. She is working hard to accomplish her goal of becoming a professional who will contribute to society. She is requesting this loan to make some of her tuition payments, so that she can continue making progress toward her goal.

loans.use: to make some of her university tuition payments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es una persona muy sacrificada, que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Él está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, lo que le abrirá muchas puertas y podrá ser el día de mañana un profesional muy exitoso.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, lo que le dará más tranquilidad a la hora de poder estudiar.
texts.en: Luis is from the city of Caaguazú. He is a person willing to make sacrifices, and he is devoting a lot of effort to becoming a professional who can contribute to society. He is studying accounting, which will open many doors for him and will allow him to be a successful professional in the future. He is requesting this loan to make his university tuition payments, which relieve some of his worries so that he can study.

loans.use: to make his university tuition payments.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que está estudiando para ser licenciada en enfermería con el propósito de sobresalir en la vida y así poder ayudar a su familia en lo económico y a la vez progresar en lo profesional.
Maria comenta que su aspiración más grande es poder tener un título y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus prácticas profesionales, como ser gastos de transporte. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Maria is someone who is studying to be licensed as a nurse, with the aim of getting ahead in life and thus being able to help her family financially and at the time same time get ahead as a professional.

Maria says that her greatest dream is to get a degree and be somebody in life.  She asks for this loan to cover career needs, such as transportation costs.  She is grateful for the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to cover career needs, such as transportation costs

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge desde chico trabajó para poder estudiar hasta el presente, él es de una familia humilde, que siempre luchó por lo que quiso.
Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, con la cual quiere poder montar su propio negocio el día de mañana.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que se le está brindando de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Since childhood, Jorge has worked in order to be able to study.  He is from a poor family and has always struggled for what he wanted.

He is studying for a business administration career, with which he wants to start his own business in the future.

He is asking for this loan in order to pay his university fees. He is thankful for the opportunity it provides and the ability to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres en Accion, son de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ubicada en una comunidad de esa ciudad, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades para poder ir creciendo.
La Sra. Sara es la presidenta del grupo, ella cuenta con un kiosko en su casa, donde realiza la venta de productos de primera necesidad y también productos de limpieza, ella con su familia llevan adelante el negocio vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su marido, además el su marido es carpintero y se dedica en ello desde su casa, y de esa forma ellos se ayudan para poder dar a sus hijos una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jugos, bebidas, golosinas, y demás, para que de esa forma siga trabajando y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres en Accion. They are from the city of San Ignacio, situated in a community of this city; they are close and supportive of each other, they work together in jobs to be able to continue growing.

Sara is the president of the group. She has a stall in her home, where she sells staples and also cleaning supplies.  She and her family carry out the business. She lives in her own home with her children and her husband. In addition, her husband is a carpenter and works from the home.  In this way they help each other to give their children a dignified life. 

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of juices, drinks, candies, and other supplies, so that in this way she will continue working and fighting to improve.

loans.use: to purchase juice, drinks, candies and other things to sell.

loans.name: Yoana

texts.es:
Yoana es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, ella comenta que siempre quiso ayudar a las personas en algo tan importante como es la salud.
Ella está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder cumplir su meta, el cual es poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad y a las demás personas.
Ella quiere pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que es un gasto un poco grande y quiere poder cubrirlo. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo, que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Yoana is in the city of Villarrica and is studying a nursing career. 

She says she has always wanted to help people with something as important as health. She is putting her best into achieving her goal, which is to be able to be a useful professional for society and other people.

She wants to pay her tuition expenses, as they are a rather large expense and she wants to be able to cover them. She is grateful for the help she's receiving, which will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to pay for tuition expenses.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Bernard is a 27-year-old man who works so hard to earn a living. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and is married with two children. He ensures that his bar and cocoa farming are well managed to raise enough income to cater for his family. He decided to start a transportation business to boost his household income to meet all his expenditures, especially his children's school fees. Although, like any other businessperson, he is challenged by competition and limited capital for his businesses. Bernard is requesting this loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive sin hijos a su cargo, en el distrito de Oyotun, una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 20 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores como cuyes, patos, pavos y gallinas y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fernando is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has no dependent children. He lives in the District of Oyotun, a rural area that is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Fernando has been raising and selling domesticated animals for 20 years. His business is located at his home. Fernando is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that he can buy small animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, turkeys, and chickens that he can offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, ducks, turkeys, and chickens.

loans.name: Sadly

texts.en: Sadly is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She was encouraged by other Cama members to venture into business and has been selling clothing for eight months. In her spare time, Sadly volunteers as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member at her local school assisting with the preparation of the school feeding program. With the requested Kiva loan, Sadly intends to buy more clothing in order to boost her sales and profits. With the additional profits, she intends to provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Petronella

texts.en: Petronella is a 24-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling men and women’s clothing for seven months. She was encouraged by other Cama (a network of graduates) members to venture into business so she could begin on the path of financial independence. In her spare time, Petronella volunteers as a Cama member at local schools. With the requested loan from Kiva, Petronella will buy more clothes at lower prices from wholesalers so that she can sell them at favorable prices and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more clothes at lower prices from wholesalers

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino es un joven estudiante de la carrera de criminalística, eligió esta carrera porque le gusta, y porque quiere poder ayudar a las personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Él se está esforzando por poder sobresalir y ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas y sus gastos de manutención, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y salir adelante para lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Cristino is a young student in the criminology program. He chose this major because he likes it and because he wants to be able to help people through his knowledge.

He is working hard to be able to improve himself and be a useful professional in society.

He asks for this loan to be able to cover the education fees and his living expenses, since in this way he will be able to continue studying and getting ahead to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees and living expenses costs.

loans.name: Ysagnne

texts.es:
Ysagnne es alumna de la Facultad de Derecho, le gustaría ser una buena abogada de aquí a cuatro años. Vive con sus padres, quienes la ayudan en sus estudios.
Ella es una persona que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y dar a su familia una ayuda de la misma forma en que esta lo ha ayudado.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Ysagnne is a student in the Law School. She would like to be good lawyer four years from now.  She lives with her parents who help her with her studies.

She is a person who is working hard to be able to get ahead and give her family some help in the same way that they have helped her.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay university fees, which will be a great help to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltero, vive con sus padres. Estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo. Es empleado de una Ferretería en el cargo de Auxiliar Administrativo, y está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de ingeniería comercial. 
Pidió este préstamo para poder comprar una notebook que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá usarla para hacer los trabajos de su universidad. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo y que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Joel is from the city of Curuguaty, is unmarried, lives with his parents. He studies and works at the same time. He works at a metalworks shop in the position of Administrative Assistant.  He is in his second year of studying commercial engineering.

He has requested this loan to buy a notebook computer that will be helpful and will be used to do his college work. 

He appreciates the help he is getting and it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy a notebook computer.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es:
Rudy viene de una familia muy trabajadora, el está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo, la carrera que está siguiendo es la de administración de empresas, y comenta que le gustaría poder tener su propia empresa en la que podrá aplicar sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus cuotas, ya que quiere cubrir ese gasto, y de esa forma seguir luchando por su meta que es la de ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Rudy comes from a very hard-working family. He is studying and working at the same time. The degree he is pursuing is business administration, and he says that he would like to be able to have his own business where he could use his knowledge.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in his fees, since he wants to pay this expense, and in this way continue fighting for his goal which is to be a professional.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana  se dedica al negocio de artesania,la socia vende  tejidos,chompas,mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of a group and is in the business of handicrafts.  She sell sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets and weavings.  She sells a variety of different fabrics.  She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.

She has 8 years this business and is doing very well.  The dream of the woman is to expand the business selling fabrics and weaving.  She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, sweaters and weaving.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her share.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sweaters and weavings.

loans.name: Shamiso

texts.en:
Shamiso is a 20-year-old business woman living in the Shurugwi district of Zimbabwe. She has been rearing broiler chickens for five months and wants to expand her business. Currently she produces batches of 50 broiler birds every six weeks. She was encouraged by the Mother Support Group in her community to start the business. 

When she is not working, Shamiso serves as a Cama (a network of graduates) member who volunteers to work in schools within the community. With the requested loan, Shamiso intends to make bulk purchases of chicks, feeding troughs, and feed in order to increase her production and boost her sales. With the additional profits she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment in her community, and pay for her university fees.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of chicks, feeding troughs, and feed in order to increase her production and boost her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta de 57 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos estudió hasta primer grado, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya están casados por lo que no dependen de ella.  


Marta se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, actualmente compra leche de vaca para hacer queso fresco y venderlo en su comunidad, ella se levanta a las 5:00 AM  y a esa hora comienza a elaborar el queso, luego tiene que ir a venderlo, para llegar al trabajo de la parcela debe hacer un recorrido de 2 kilómetros a pie y regresa a las 4:00 para hacer los oficios del hogar.



El dinero del préstamo sera utilizado para la siembra de maíz. 



Marta sueña con tener un terreno propio donde vivir, además le gustaría  poner una tienda para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marta is 57 years old. Due to a lack of financial resources, she was only able to study through the first grade. She has two children who are already married and no longer dependent on her.

Marta works in agriculture, a trade that she learned from her parents. She currently buys cow’s milk in order to make fresh cheese that she can sell in her community. Marta wakes up at 5:00 A.M. so that she can begin making cheese before going out to sell it. In order to arrive at the parcel of land where she does her farm work, she must travel two kilometers on foot. She returns home at 4:00 P.M. in order to complete her household chores.

The money from her loan will be used for planting corn. Marta dreams of having her own plot of land on which she can live. In addition, she would like to open a store so that she can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Saadi

texts.en: Saadi is a 29-year-old, married male with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a very ambitious man who wants to work hard for his family. With the little savings from his coffee and cocoa farming, he decided to start a retail shop to improve his incomes. He hopes to expand his business to a big store. Like any other businessman, he is challenged with bad debtors and poor transport means for his commodities. He is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, sugar, yellow bananas and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, yellow bananas and soap to sell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi district of Zimbabwe. She has had a business selling clothes for the past four months. She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into business so that she could look after herself and provide herself with bus fare for Cama meetings. During her spare time, Sharon volunteers at schools within her community. 

With the requested loan from Kiva, Sharon plans to buy more clothing and purchase shoes for all ages. With the additional profits she intends to pay for school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and purchase shoes for all ages

loans.name: Yulisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Yulisa del Carmen mayor de edad casada con tres hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, y sus hermosas playas, Yulisa del Carmen siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, dedicada a su negocio y a sus hijos de los que esta muy orgullosa de que ellos estén saliendo adelante y pronto sean unos profesionales lo que ella no logro por venir de una familia con poco recursos económicos por lo que no logra terminar sus estudios y se dedica a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos familiares, Yulisa es una microempresaria que se dedica ala compra venta de juguetes y bisuterías en unos de los parques de la ciudad y de forma ambulante, negocio que tiene ya varios años de tenerlos y el cual va creciendo poco a poco y ha sido un medio de vida  y sostenible para su familia, con su negocio a logrado que dos de sus hijos estén en la universidad para ella un sueño hecho realidad en vista que ella no pudo lograrlo porque tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven.  sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de mayoreos de otro departamento, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de juguetes como: diferentes estilos de carros grandes, pequeños y chiquitos, robots, trompetas, chinchines sonadores, burbujas, pelotas, peluches, anillos, pulceras, aretes, cadenas, esmaltes de uñas, pósteres de muñecos, rompecabezas entre otros,para así ofrecer variedades estilos de juguetes y bisuterías a sus clientes y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Sus sueños siguen siendo ver que sus hijos son profesionales de éxito y tener la oportunidad de verlos crecer profesionalmente su familia ha sido el motor para seguir adelante y lograr mejorar su nivel de vida. Yulisa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre económicamente como es Nicaragua para tener una fuente de trabajo digna.
texts.en:
Yulisa del Carmen, is married with three children under her care. She is originally from the Chinandega area where commerce, tourism, and beautiful beaches predominate. Yulisa del Carmen has always been known for being a hardworking and responsible woman. She is dedicated to her business and her children and is proud of them as they are getting ahead and will soon become professionals which she could not do as she came from a family with scarce resources so she could not finish her studies and worked to help with the family expenses.

Yulisa is a micro entrepreneur who sells toys and jewelry as a traveling salesperson in one of the city parks, a business that she has had for several years and it has been growing little by little and has been a way of life and a means to support her family. She makes her purchases in one of the wholesale markets in another department. 

She needs this new loan so she can invest in working capital and supply her business by buying games such as: different kinds of toy cars big, small and tiny, robots, trumpets, cymbals, dreaming castanets, bubble soap, balls, stuffed animals, rings, bracelets, earrings, chains, nail polish, paper dolls, puzzles, and more so she can offer a variety of styles of games and jewelry to her customers and thus improve her earnings. 

Her dream continues to be that her children become successful professionals and that she has the opportunity to see them grow professionally. Her family has been what has motivated her to get ahead and improve their standard of living. Yulisa is grateful for the help of Kiva lenders to small business merchants with few resources in economically poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a source of decent work.

loans.use: to buy different styles of toy cars, bubble soap, balls, earrings, bracelets and more

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cigarros y champus,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de champús y cigarros. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar champús y cigarros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of a group and is still in to the business of selling cigars and “champus” [a warm drink made with corn and fruit].  She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.

The woman has several years experience in this business and is doing very well.  Her dream is to expand the business of selling champus and cigars. The member requesting a loan to buy more champus and cigars.

She is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her share.

loans.use: to buy “champus” [a warm drink made with corn and fruit] and cigars for resale.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es: Don Jose Santiago tiene establecido su propio cafetin que es atendido por él mismo y su esposa, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independiente, Pensando en su vejes y en cualquier necesidad se ha dedicado a este tipo de negocio por mas de 6 años ademas recibe ingresos por su jubilacion que antes laborara para una institucion estatal de conductor, siendo estos ingresos para el soporte familia en su hogar.  con el animo de  continuar incrementando su negocio solicita credito para comprar productos como carnes, gaseosas, jugos, verduras y otros para el negocio; asi poder obtener mayores ingresos que le serviran de mucho en su futuro.
texts.en:
Jose Santiago has had his own snack stand for six years now, which he and his wife work. Their children are all adults and independent. Jose Santiago started this business to provide additional income during his retirement and to pay for whatever expenses may come along. He receives a pension from his previous job as a driver in a state institution, which he uses to pay household expenses.

He is requesting this loan to buy meat, soft drinks, juices and vegetables to continue growing his business. He hopes to improve his income, which will be of great use to him in the future.

loans.use: buy meat, soft drinks, juices, and vegetables for his snack stand.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old, married and supports four people in his family. He has been selling used clothing and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

He has applied for his third loan of 24,000 KES, which he will use to buy more stock of clothes for sale. He paid his previous loan successfully.

He hopes to grow his business and open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Powel

texts.en:
Powel is a thirty-three-year-old man. He is married with three children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

After Powel realized that his income from the teaching profession was very little to cater to his family’s cost of living, he was determined to practice cocoa farming and improve on his household income. Although he is committed to work and loves it, like any other farmer, he is faced with unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation in the market. 

Powel is asking for this loan to buy cocoa for selling to his customers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more gallons of palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water, plantain, banana, and peanuts

loans.name: Tessa

texts.en:
Tessa is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been running a grocery store that sells sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing soap. 

She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to start a business so that she could look after herself and begin to reverse the cycle of poverty in her family. In her spare time, Tessa volunteers at her local schools, where she disseminates health information to students. 

With the requested loan, Tessa intends to buy more groceries from wholesalers at lower cost so that she can sell at more favorable prices and attract a higher number of customers. With the additional profits, she plans to provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: to buy more groceries from wholesalers at lower cost so that she can sell at more favorable prices and attract a higher number of customers.

loans.name: Ishtvan

texts.ru:
Иштван — из Берегово. С момента получения предыдущей суммы от КИВА его семье пришлось столкнуться с определенными трудностями. У Иштвана сильно заболела жена и им пришлось продать микроавтобус, который был куплен с суммы, полученной в предыдущий раз, распустить бригаду и поехать на операцию жены в Россию к знакомым. Вернувшись после окончания курса лечения жены, Иштван купил легковую машину и теперь работает сам и, более того, взялся за окончание начатого строительства. Со временем Иштван надеется вернуть прежние обороты и снова набрать бригаду для работы. 
Сумма в 40 000 гривен нужна Иштвану для того, чтобы улучшить условия проживния, поштукатурить дом снаружи и изнутри, а также обустроить ванную комнату.
texts.en: Ishtvan is from Beregovo.  Since his last loan from Kiva, his family has run into some problems; his wife fell ill and they had to sell the van they bought with the loan, as well as dismiss the crew they'd hired, to take her to Russia for medical treatment.  After his wife's treatment ran its course and they returned to Beregovo, Ishtvan bought a small car and started working again by himself; in addition, he continued the renovation of their home from where he left off.  With time, Ishtvan hopes to pay back the previous loan he took out, as well as hire another crew for work; for the time being, he would like to improve his family's living conditions, and is seeking an additional loan of 40,000 hryvnia to plaster the walls of his house inside and out, as well as renovate his bathroom.

loans.use: plaster the walls of his house and reconstruct his bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase various goods (cassava flour, soaps, creams, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Gasparin Group

texts.es:
Gretel: Es una mujer amable, originaria Puerto Cabezas, tiene 29 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos. Su pareja, trabaja en el gobierno municipal. Desde hace 7 años estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de bastimentos, pescado, nancite, coco, mango entre otras frutas. Es la Coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Gasparin, conformado hace 2 meses por 3 mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es establecer pulpería para que la administre su hija. 

Beksi: Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar insumos, para la elaboración de refrescos naturales, bolsas plásticas, pajillas, gaseosas y jugos. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.

Dina: Solicita financiamiento para comprar insumos para la elaboración de manera artesanal de pan y venta de gaseosa: harina, levadura, aceite, coco. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
Gretel is a friendly woman who is originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Her partner works for the municipal government. Seven years ago, Gretel established her small business of selling provisions, fish, nance fruit, coconuts, mangos, and other types of produce. She is the group coordinator for the solidarity group named “Gasparin”, which was established two months ago. The group consists of three enterprising women who are requesting loans in order to buy merchandise. Her dream is establish a grocery store that she can manage with her daughter.

Beksi is requesting her first loan in order to buy supplies for making natural beverages such as plastic bags, straws, sodas, and juices. Her dream is to set up a grocery store in her home.

Dina is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for producing homemade bread and selling sodas. She will buy flour, yeast, oil, and coconuts. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy provisions, fruit, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Rutendo

texts.en: Rutendo is a 21-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She is currently successfully rearing broiler chickens in batches of 25 birds every six weeks. She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into business so that she could look after herself. Rutendo volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in schools within the community disseminating heath information. With the requested loan, Rutendo intends to buy chicks, feed, and vaccines so that she can produce more broiler chickens in that same six-week period.  This will enable her to improve her sales and profit levels. With the additional profits, she will be able to provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed, and vaccines for her poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her rental house facility.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Yolanda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 51 años de edad  de estado civil soltera vive con sus hijos en el cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, frejol y a la cría de ganado. Solicita el crédito para la compra ganado. Las compras realiza en el mercado de San Pablo. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y  la venta de ganado. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 51 years old and single. She lives with her children in San Miguel Canton in Bolívar Province. She is a member of the solidarity group Patrón San Miguel, which is located in the community of Pailaloma, forty minutes from the office of the field partner. The members of this solidarity group work in agriculture.

Yolanda works growing corn and beans and raising cattle. She is requesting this loan to buy cattle, which she will buy in the San Pablo market. Her goal is to increase her harvests and cattle sales. In her free time she likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is 56 years old and married. She has been making and selling nimko (a traditional spicy and yummy snack) for two years. She makes packets of nimko in various sizes according to the demands of her customers. She makes enough to contribute to the family’s income. She serves well in her community. 

Zubeda requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy ingredients, such as assorted daals (lentils) and dried fruit, in large quantities to increase her sales. She wishes to spend a part of the profits on her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as assorted daals (lentils) and dried fruit, in large quantities.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business selling cloth. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality fabric in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Mehmooda

texts.en: Mehmooda, a 48-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Mehmooda has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Mehmooda's 7th loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de servicio de transporte,el socio tiene un carro donde hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermo continues to operate his taxi business. He has one car that he uses to offer taxi services between 8 a.m. and 5 p.m. He has had this business for several years and it is going well for him. His dream is to buy a new car.

He is requesting this loan to buy tires for his taxi. He is happy for the loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana still runs her toy trading business. Liana imports toys from United Arab Emirates and other countries and resells them in her rented place in one of Yerevan’s subways. She greatly thanks Kiva lenders for the last two loans and hopes for the third one. Liana has great changes in her life and she really needs financial support, which will again develop her business and income, in turn solving a very important problem for her. Liana got married and she is already pregnant and unbelievably happy.  As Liana says everything is great in her life, but she and her husband still live with her brother’s family and they dream to have their own cute flat before the baby is born. Liana’s business is a profitable one, that is already obvious, but some support will be very useful.
 
The assortment of her toys in the shop is a little bit poor and she is going to refresh and enlarge it. That is why she needs this loan and hopes to have it this time also.

loans.use: to refresh and enlarge the assortment of her toys and presents.

loans.name: Praymore

texts.en:
Praymore is a 25-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been raising broiler chickens for four months now. She produces them in batches of 25 birds. Praymore also volunteers with other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members, cleaning school premises within their community.  

With the requested loan, Praymore intends to buy more chicks, feed and feeding troughs to expand her fowl run so that she can produce more broiler chickens and increase her sales and profits. With the additional profits she plans to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, feed and feeding troughs to expand her fowl run so that she can produce more broiler chickens and increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She initiated her business of milk sales, as her husband’s income is insufficient to cover all household expenses.  She has been doing this business for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Recently she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She dreams of providing a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a 51-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of selling milk for the past two years. She has two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has two children, both of whom are going to school. She is very motivated to provide a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing for her children.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with support for it. Now she requested a loan of Rs 50,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in her net income through larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Asiyia

texts.en:
Asiyia is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. 

Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good-quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their three children. 

Currently, Asiyia requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, grains and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a face massage machine and a laser hair removal machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another large refrigerator in order to have cold water and ice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries in order to improve her sales and increase her profits.

loans.name: Elizabeth Elina

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, en el Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Elizabeth  se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva maíz, mora y a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos y materiales para la siembra. La compra lo realiza en el mercado de San Pablo. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales y la producción de maíz. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a las labores de la casa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 24 years old and single. She lives with her two children, ages 8 and 4, in San Miguel Canton in Bolívar Province. She is a member of the solidarity group Patrón San Miguel, which is located in the community of Pailaloma, 40 minutes from the office of the field partner. The members of this solidarity group work in agriculture.

Elizabeth works growing corn and blackberries and raising livestock. She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure and other materials for her crops. She will buy these items in the San Pablo market. Her goal is to improve her livestock sales and corn production. Her challenges include the climate and infestations in her crops. She uses her free time to do the housework.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil unión libre, vive con su conviviente y sus hijos de 21, 12 y 11 años de edad en la comunidad Pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Martha se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frejol y a la crianza de vacas. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de insumos agrícolas. La compra lo realiza en mercado de San Pablo. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Su desafío es el mal tiempo, plagas y enfermedades. En su tiempo libre se dedica a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 42 years old and lives with her partner in the community of Pailaloma in the San Miguel canton, Bolivar province. Their children are aged 21, 12, and 11. Martha is a member of the Patrón San Miguel group which is located in Pailaloma, some 40 minutes from the cooperative’s office. The members are farmers.

Martha grows corn and beans, and also raises cows. She is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies. She buys them from the San Pablo market. Her goal is to improve her standard of living. Her biggest challenges are bad weather, infestations, and disease. Martha likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 26-year-old married man from Gaza. He got married recently and now he lives with his wife in a small house. For the past year, Mohannad has been working in his rickshaw, where he distributes consumer goods to the local traders. He buys products at a discounted price and resells them. It is a good business, but he still needs to improve it.

Mohannad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products from wholesalers and resell them to traders. This will increase his sales and also his income.

Mohannad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products from wholesalers and resell them to traders.

loans.name: Dalmecia

texts.es:
La socia Dalmecia se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania,la socia vende  tejidos,chompas,mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Dalmecia continues to work in the business of hand made crafts. She sells weavings, sweaters, tablecloths and looms. She sells different types of weavings and works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She has worked in this business for 8 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her weavings and looms. She is asking for the loan to buy weavings, sweaters and looms.

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy weavings, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Marcelino Eloy

texts.es:
Marcelino es un hombre trabajador, tiene 52 años de edad, y vive en el Distrito de Camaná junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de cebolla, frijol, arroz entre otros productos de excelente calidad. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindarle todas las comodidades a su familia. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder dar un futuro mejor y una buena educación a sus hijos.
Marcelino está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes, agro-químicos para poder realizar el mantenimiento de las plantas y así en la cosecha pueda obtener productos de mejor calidad. Con esto él obtendrá mayores ingresos que podrá ser utilizado para amoblar su hogar y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a hardworking man. He is 52 years old and he lives in the district of Camaná with his family. For several years he has worked growing onions, rice and other excellent quality products. Since he was very young he has worked to be able to give his children a better future and a good education. 
Marcelino is grateful to the Kiva lenders because because with their support he will be able to buy materials such as fertilizer, and agro-chemicals to be able to do maintenance on the plants and the crops to obtain the best quality products. With it, he will obtain better profits that he will be able to use to furnish his home and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to do maintenance on his crops.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en la comunidad Pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Manuel se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frejol, mora y a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de insumos agrícolas. La compra lo realiza en mercado de San Pablo. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Su desafío es el mal tiempo, plagas y enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Manuel is 32 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the Pailaloma community, which is part of the San Miguel Canton in the Bolivar Province.   He is a member of the Patrón San Miguel selling group, which is located in the Pailaloma community, 40 minutes from the cooperative offices.  He is a farmer.  Manuel plants corn, beans, berries, and raises cattle.  He is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies.  He will make his purchase in the San Pablo market.  His goal is to improve his living conditions.  The challenges he faces are bad weather, infestations, and disease. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase planting supplies.

loans.name: Ferzana

texts.en:
Ferzana, age 32, is a married woman. She has four children. She is keen to provide her family members with a better standard of living.  

Eight years ago, she started a business selling cloth material in her community. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Ferzana is requesting a 55,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.
