She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava, coal and water for resale.

loans.name: Heydi Elena

texts.es:
Jugar a ser la maestra era una de las actividades favoritas de Heydi cuando era una niña, siempre ponía el orden entre sus amiguitas y dictaba muy bien la lección. Hoy, ser maestra es su vocación. Tiene 25 años, es madre soltera y cursa quinto año de biología química en modalidad sabatina. Aparte de estudiar, hace dos años, empezó a trabajar los días de semana como docente en la clase de biología. Esmero y dedicación, son dos palabras que han definido a está gran mujer, quien día a día lucha por brindarle lo mejor a sus dos hijas, ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de sus padres.
Heydi solicita el crédito para el pago de los gastos de titulación y de graduación. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que al obtener su titulo será certificada como licenciada, de manera que logrará obtener mejores ofertas de trabajo y al mismo tiempo podrá recibir un salario justo e indicado. Anhela seguir siendo de mucha ayuda en la sociedad, seguir poniendo en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos y  ser la profesora que orienta a sus estudiantes por el camino del éxito.
texts.en:
When she was a child, one of Heydi’s favourite games was playing school. She always used to keep her little friends in order and taught them their lessons. Now she wishes to be a real teacher. She is 25 years old, a single mother, and studying year five of biology and chemistry on Saturdays. As well as studying, two years ago Heydi started teaching biology on weekdays. 

Careful and dedicated are two words that define this wonderful woman who works hard every day to provide the best she can for her two daughters. She has managed to bring them up with the help of her parents.

Heydi is seeking a loan to pay for courses and graduation. She is confident that the loan will be a great help. Once she has her teaching qualifications, she will get better offers of employment and be paid fairly. She longs to be a help in society and put into practice the knowledge she now has. She wishes to be the kind of teacher that helps her students find the road to success.

loans.use: pay for courses and graduation

loans.name: Shelter

texts.en:
Shelter is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothing for all ages and genders for five months now. She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members and Mother Support Groups in her community to start the business. When she is not working, Shelter serves as a Learner Guide at the nearest secondary school, providing homework assistance to students. 

With the requested loan, Shelter intends to make bulk purchases of clothing to increase her sales and profits. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment for the people of her community and provide for her siblings.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES DE HUAYANAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
  
La socia Felipa  se dedica al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos,cafe,mandarinas y naranjas,la socia tambien tiene un negocio de polleria, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the  “LOS ANGELES DE HUAYANAY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Santa Ana district, in the La Convención province in the state of Cuzco.
  
Felipa cultivates fruit. She has a plot where she plants bananas, coffee, mandarins and oranges.  She also has a chicken business.  She works from 6am to 5pm. She has had this business for many years and it has gone very well.  Her dream is to expand her agricultural land.  She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.   She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en Camaná junto a su familia.
Tiene 3 maravillosos hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes trabaja día a día para poder brindarles un mejor futuro. Sale muy temprano a trabajar, desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando principalmente frijol y arroz, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy luchadora, emprendedora y sobre todo porque tiene muchos conocimientos sobre sus cultivos y obtiene como resultado productos de excelente calidad.
Victor está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos (fertilizantes, plaguicidas)para llevar a cabo el mantenimiento del cultivo hasta la etapa de cosecha y así pueda obtener mayores ingresos con los que podrá más adelante innovar en nuevos cultivos.
texts.en:
Victor is a very hardworking man. He is 41 years old and lives in Camaná with his family.  

He has 3 wonderful children who are his his greatest pride and the ones he works for day to day to be able to offer them a better future. For many years, he has gone out very early to work in farming. He plants mainly beans and corn. It is going very well for him because he is a fighter and he is enterprising. Above all, he has a lot of knowledge about his crops and as a result he obtains excellent quality products.

Victor is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help, he will be able to buy materials (fertilizers and pesticides) to do maintenance on his crops until harvest. This way, he will make more income so in he future he can innovate with new crops.

loans.use: to buy materials to do maintenance on his crop (fertilizer, pesticides).

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for the past twelve years. 

She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 49-year-old energetic, married lady. She has six children. Her husband is employed with a low salary/income to bear the family’s expenses alone. 

In order to overcome all the financial problems, she initiated a small general store at the corner of her house. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Akhtar needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase stock of biscuits, snacks, sweets and grains. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase stock of biscuits, snacks, sweets and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 25 years old and she lives with her mother in Kapan city in Syunik region. Meri graduated from boarding school and after that she attended hairdressing courses. For five years at their house she provided hairdressing services and her customers were her friends, relatives and neighbors. Now she works at a beauty salon and the number of her customers has increased because of her professionalism and good skills. Meri’s mother works at the Kadjaran combine at the canteen as a cook.

Meri asks for this loan since she decided to attend courses for make-up and manicures, for which she must buy some materials and tools and must also pay for the courses. This will give her the chance to earn more income and create better living conditions for her small family.

loans.use: to attend courses for make-up and manicures, for which she must buy some materials and tools and must also pay for the courses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES DE HUAYANAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Fortunata se dedica al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos,cafe,mandarinas,naranjas,cafe y cacao, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “LOS ANGELES DE HUAYANAY” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, belonging to the province of La Convención and the department of Cuzco.

Fortunata is a member who works growing fruit. She has land where she grows plantains, coffee, tangerines, oranges, and cacao. She works from  6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for several years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand her cropland. She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more local stoves for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Dorila

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 74 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 28 años en la comunidad pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Blanca se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frejol y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de insumos agrícolas. La compra lo realiza en mercado de San Pablo. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Su desafío es el mal tiempo, plagas y enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en:
Blanca is 74 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and her 28 year old son in the Pailaloma community, which is located in the Canton of San Miguel in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the Patrón San Miguel communal bank which is located in the community of Pailaloma, about 40 minutes from the cooperative office.  She works in agriculture.  

Blanca plants corn and beans, and raises pigs.  She is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies which she will buy in the San Pablo market.  Her goal is to improve her living conditions.  The challenges she faces are bad weather, infestations, and disease.  In her free time she likes to knit.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cookies and fruit.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa vive en Lima junto a sus padres. Ellos son personas mayores y apenas ganan lo necesario para poder cubrir sus gastos de alimentación en casa.
Los hermanos mayores de Rosa ayudan económicamente en los gastos de la casa de sus padres, pero al tener ya una familia propia, el dinero que brindan es muy poco, por lo que Rosa tendrá que dejar de estudiar para tener que trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Ella esta cursando actualmente el 3er semestre académico de la especialidad de administración Industrial y su deseo es terminar lo mas pronto posible para poder trabajar en una empresa donde valoren su esfuerzo y dedicación y así ayudar a sus padres en el mantenimiento del hogar. 
Es por esto que desea agradecer a los prestamistas de Kiva por toda la ayuda que le pueden brindar a ella y a muchas jóvenes con deseos de superación. 
Ella cree que en estos tiempos modernos, tanto las mujeres como los hombres tienen derecho a una buena educación, por lo que confía que en un futuro próximo se logre esta igualdad aun en crecimiento en los países de américa latina.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Lima with her parents. They are elderly and hardly earn enough to cover food for the household. Rosa’s older siblings help financially but as they have families of their own, the money they can contribute is very small. Rosa will have to stop her studies and get a job if she doesn’t get help from Kiva lenders.

She is currently studying the third academic semester specializing in industrial administration. Her wish is to finish as soon as possible so she can find work in a company that values her hard work and dedication. Then she will be able to help her parents with household expenses.

For this reason Rosa wishes to thank Kiva lenders for all the help they bring to her and many young people who wish to get ahead. She believes that in these modern times women as well as men have the right to a good education. She believes that in the near future she will have an equal education as will people in other latin american countries.

loans.use: pay for technical courses in industrial administration

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 41-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she is able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Marcos Ramiro

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo e hijo de 18 años  en la comunidad Pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Marcos se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frejol y mora. Solicita el crédito para  el mantenimiento del cultivo de mora. La compra lo realiza en mercado de San Pablo. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Su desafío es el mal tiempo, plagas y enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir de viaje.
texts.en:
Marcos is 55, married, and lives with his wife and 18-year-old son in the town of Pailaloma in San Miguel Canton in Bolivar Province. He is a member of the Patron San Miguel Communal Bank, which is also located in Pailaloma, about 40 minutes from Marcos's home, and whose members all work in agriculture. 

Marcos grows corn, beans, and blackberries. He is applying for a loan to pay for maintenance of his blackberry crop. Marcos hopes to improve his family's living conditions, but he faces obstacles such as poor weather, pests, and plant diseases. He likes to travel in his spare time.

loans.use: for maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
No hay necesidad de visitar un supermercado porque en la pulpería de Freddy se encuentra una gran variedad de productos. Así opinan los clientes  que diariamente visitan su local,  no solo por los artículos que ofrece,  sino también por la excelente atención que brinda. Desde hace cuatro años estableció su propio negocio y gracias al esfuerzo, disciplina y por supuesto  buena administración,  hoy  goza de buenas ganancias.
Empezó vendiendo productos básicos en una pequeña área de su hogar, sin embargo, el local ha crecido increíblemente. Las ganancias las invierte  en  otros artículos para llamar  la atención del público. Los sueños de Freddy no terminan aquí. Acaba de unirse a la familia de KIVA MiCrédito. El solicitó un préstamo con el fin de adquirir capital y comprar Arroz, Frijoles, Aceite, Azucar entre otros. Los ingresos serán destinados para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en: There is no need to visit a supermarket because in Freddy's grocery store one finds a great variety of products. This is what the customers who visit his store every day think; not only because of the items he offers but also because of the excellent service he provides. He established his own business four years ago, and thanks to his effort, discipline and good management, of course, he currently earns well. He started selling basic products in a small area of his house. However, his store has grown incredibly. He invests the earnings in other items in order to catch the public's attention. Freddy's dreams do not end here. He has just joined the family of KIVA loans. He requested a loan with the purpose of getting capital and buying rice, beans, oil, sugar, among other things. He will use the income to improve his house's infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: Melody is a 24-year-old mother of two. She is single and lives in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe with her children.  Melody has been selling men’s and women’s clothes for one year now.  Apart from running her business, she also volunteers in her community, leading sessions on life skills and general well-being to young people. With the requested Kiva loan, Melody would like to purchase better quality clothing from wholesalers at a lower price compared to a retail market. With the additional profits, Melody would like to open additional branches of her clothing shop and create employment for people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase better quality clothing for resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a 21-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a poultry business for five months. She produces batches of 50 broiler chickens every six weeks and would like to increase that amount. She was encouraged by other Cama (a network of graduates) members to venture into business so that she could look after herself. During her spare time, Isabel volunteers as a community health trainer at local schools. With the requested loan, Isabel intends to buy more chicks, feed, feeding troughs and vaccines so that she can produce higher batches of broiler chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, feed, feeding troughs and vaccines so that she can produce higher batches of broiler chickens.

loans.name: Thembeleni

texts.en: Thembeleni lives in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe. She is 23 years old and a single mother of one. For the past two years, Thembeleni has been selling second hand clothing for men and women at the local flea market. She also volunteers with Camfed as a Learner Guide in her community, delivering presentations focused on well-being to students in schools. Thembeleni intends to increase the volume of clothes she sells by purchasing them from wholesalers at lower costs. The additional profits would help her pay school fees for her siblings. She also wishes to attend college to become a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Salia Griselda

texts.es:
Salia de 25 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, esta acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, el cual tienen 3 hijos que aun no ingresan a estudiar hasta el próximo año. Salia junto a su su pareja se encargan del mantenimiento de sus hijos. Desde que tenia 10 años ella es comerciante de verduras y pescado, y aprendió el oficio de su madre, la cliente sale a vender a las comunidades cercanas en un huacal y se traslada  en bus, su horario es de 5:00 am a 12:00 md. 

El préstamo es para invertir en el negocio y comprar pescado fresco y seco; ademas una gran variedad de verduras por ejemplo: cebolla, tomate, chile, pipian y ademas especies (achiote, comino).   Los sueños para el negocio es seguir vendiendo cada vez mas, por mayor para tener ganancias, ir ahorrando porque su otro sueño es que sus hijos empiecen a estudiar el próximo año.
texts.en:
Salia is 25 and married to a farmer. The couple has three young children, and although Salia herself didn't have the opportunity to pursue an education, her children will enter school next year.  

Salia has sold vegetables and fish since she was 10 years old, having learned the business from her mother. She works from 5 a.m. to noon, traveling around nearby communities with a crate that she carries on a bus. 

Salia is applying for a loan to invest in her business, and will buy fresh and dried fish, as well as a wide variety of vegetables: onions, tomatoes, chiles, pipian, and others such as achiote and cumin. Salia hopes to grow her business steadily in order to earn more income that she can save for her children's school tuition next year.

loans.use: to purchase fresh and dried fish, as well as a wide variety of vegetables: onions, tomatoes, chiles, pipian [a type of squash], and others such as achiote [fruit of a small tree] and cumin.

loans.name: Sirun

texts.en:
Sirun is happy and very anxious to have her second loan with Kiva since the first one was profitable and very good for her. Once the Kiva loan helped her to develop her food and household trading business, she wanted to continue her partnership further. Sirun lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region with her husband and her mother-in-law. Her husband helps Sirun greatly in her business. She works in a rented shop near the center of the city, where she sells food and household products (dairy products, bread, sweets, juices, cans and sausages, and also washing powder, shampoos, soaps, etc.). Her shop is always cute and clean and that is why Sirun has no lack of customers. This is also because of her great assortment of products that she has in her shop.

The loan that Sirun this time hopes to get from Kiva lenders also will be spent in the development of her business; she will use it to increase the variety of goods in her shop, and she also wants to buy a big see-through refrigerator, where she can neatly arrange the assortment of dairy products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy a big see-through refrigerator where she can neatly arrange the assortment of dairy products for her customers.

loans.name: Sazini

texts.en: Sazini is a 22-year-old entrepreneur living in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe with her parents and siblings. She has been selling skirts, blouses, handbags and shoes, along with men’s jeans, at a flea market for the past two months. In addition to running the business, Sazini is also a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers her time teaching local students life skills education. In addition, she delivers health information to her community. With the requested Kiva loan, Sazini will purchase more clothes, shoes and handbags so that her sales may increase. With the increased profits, she intends to supplement her education by taking more courses and providing for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children. She has established a small store in a corner of her house. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees, which she will use to buy stock of grains, toiletries, juices and milk. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy stock of grains, toiletries, juices and milk.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 42 años de edad,  estudio hasta 4º grado, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 3 hijos que viven con ellos y actualmente estudian kinder y primer grado. Manuel es el encargado de mantener a su familia. 

 Desde hace 10 años Manuel se dedica a la agricultura y lo aprendió de su padre, ya que lo acompañaba cuando hacia las labores agrícolas, piensa sembrar maíz de postrera 7,000 metros cuadrados y el terreno donde cultiva esta a 2 km y se va caminando. 

Necesita del crédito para mejorar la vivienda, específicamente mandara hacer 2 puertas con balcón, pues la que tiene son de madera y están bien deterioradas y tiene que colocarlas para cerrar. El sueño es ir poco a poco, mejorando la vivienda para que sus hijos crezcan en un lugar digno y que ellos terminen el año escolar.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old, he went to school up to the 4th grade, and he is married. His wife takes care of the chores at home. He has three children that live with them and attend kindergarten and first grade. Manuel is in charge of taking care of his family. 

Manuel has made a living from agriculture for 10 years, something he learned from his father because he would accompany him when he did the agricultural labor. He is planning to plant 7,000 squared meters of corn, and the land where he cultivates it is 2 km away; he gets there by walking. 

He needs the loan to improve his home. Specifically, he will purchase two metal doors with safety bars because the ones he has are wooden and very deteriorated (he has to put them in place to close them). His dream is to improve his home, little by little, so that his children grow up in a worthy place and finish their school year.

loans.use: to make 2 metal doors with safety bars because the ones he has are wooden doors.

loans.name: Snider

texts.en:
Snider is 39 years old and the single mother of one child who is 13 years old. She also supports eight other members of the family.

For the last three years Snider has been selling secondhand clothing and at same time running a pharmacy as a secondary business with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. She has applied for her first loan from Visionfund Kenya to boost her business by buying more stock of assorted drugs to sell.

In the future she desires to grow her business and buy a piece of land and build a house and start venturing in farming activities.

loans.use: to buy assorted drugs to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Valeria

texts.es: Elizabeth Valeria, mayor de edad acompañada con una hija menor de edad aun estudiante de primaria, originaria de Chinandega ubicada en el occidente del país, inicia sus negocios con fondos propios de ahorros que tenía, los cuales consisten en la venta de tamales pisques, hielo, frijoles, leña, nacatamales entre otros, los cuales los desempeña con mucho cariño, su jornada diaria inicia desde el día anterior con la elaboración del hielo, proceso que es muy sencillo fácil y rápido el cual consiste en la poner agua en una bolsa y luego amarrarla, con las ventas de tamales, su proceso es un poco largo por que tiene que poner a nesquizar el maíz, se le agrega la cal, el maíz y se pone al fogón el cual se cocina a fuego lento, luego se lava y después se pone al fuego agregándole ceniza para pisquear el maíz hasta que este quede amarillo y se lava nuevamente listo para irse a moler el maíz, se compran las hojas chagüite y se coloca la masa se cierra el tamal y se pone a coser nuevamente hasta que este esté listo para comer, en el proceso de los deliciosos nacatamales tiene casi el mismo procedimiento  con la única diferencia que este no se pisquea sino que una vez nesquizado el maíz se lava y se manda a moler luego se amasa y se pone a coser con manteca de cerdo, después se deja enfriar mientras se condimenta la carne de cerdo con todos los ingredientes que se le agrega como: achote para darle un poco de color, vinagre, sal, después se le agrega tomates, cebolla, hierva buena, chiltomas, papas, arroz, Chile, pasas, después de baja del fuego se coloca en las hojas de plátanos y se amarra se pone a fuego lento hasta que se cosa muy bien y esté listo para vender, este negocio lo realiza solo los fines de semana que es donde más demanda tiene, compra la leña a comerciantes de leña que les ofrece en su casa de habitación, negocios el cual lo aprende gracias a su mama desde muy joven ya que han sido de escasos recursos economicos, todos los dias ella se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus actividades economicas,  tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus compras las realiza al contado, uno de sus sueños es poder tener sus propia casa y brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija su deseo es lograr que su hija vaya a la universidad se prepare y tenga un nivel de vida mejor al que ella a tenido, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en sus negocios en la compra de productos para la realización de los deliciosos nacatamales, tamales pisques, compra de leña, y lograr suplir con la demanda que tiene de sus clientes para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener mayores ingresos
texts.en: Elizabeth Valeria is an adult and is in a relationship. She has a minor child who is still in primary school. She is a native of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She started her businesses with her own funds from savings that she had, and they consist of selling tamales pisques [tamales with a bean filling], ice, beans, firewood, and nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales], among others, which she does with great care. Her day starts the night before with making the ice, a process that is very simple, easy, and fast, and which consists of putting water in a bag and then tying it up, and with selling tamales. That process is a bit long because she has to prepare the corn with lime, adding the lime to the corn and putting it on the stove, cooking it on low heat. Then it is washed and afterwards it is put on the fire, adding ash to the corn until it remains yellow. Then it is washed again, ready to be ground. Banana leaves are bought and the masa is placed inside. The tamale is closed and cooked again until it is ready to eat. The process for the delicious nacatamales is almost the same, with the only difference being that the nacatamales are not treated with ash but rather once the corn is prepared with lime it is washed and sent to be ground. Then it is mixed and cooked with pig lard. Afterwards it is left to cool while the pig meat is seasoned with all the ingredients that are added to it such as achiote to give it a little color, vinegar, and salt. Then tomatoes, onion, mint, sweet peppers, potatoes, rice, chiles, and raisins are added. After taking it off the flame it is placed in the banana leaves, tied, and put on a low heat until it is very well cooked and ready to sell. She only works on this business on the weekends, which is when she has more demand. She buys the firewood from firewood merchants who offer it to her at her home. She learned these businesses thanks to her mother from the time she was very young, since they had few economic resources. Every day she gets up very early to perform her work. She has regular and casual customers. She makes her purchases in cash. One of her dreams is to be able to have her own house and give her daughter a better future. Her desire is for her daughter to go to college, prepare herself, and have a better standard of living than she has had. The goal of this new loan is to invest in her businesses by buying products to make the delicious nacatamales and tamales pisques, to buy firewood, and to be able to fulfill the demand she has from her customers so that in a not-too-distant future she can have more income.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, corn, lime, sweet peppers, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, banana leaves, firewood, bags of ice, and raisins, among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Silvia Aracely

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad en la comunidad Pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma A unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Silvia se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frejol y a la crianza de vacas. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de insumos agrícolas. La compra lo realiza en mercado de San Miguel. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Su desafío es el mal tiempo, plagas y enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Silvia is 26 years old, she is married, and lives with her husband and two-year-old son in the Pailaloma community, which belongs to the Bolívar province of Cantón San Miguel. 

She is a member of the Patrón San Miguel solidarity group, located in the Pailaloma community and 40 minutes away from the cooperative, and dedicated to agriculture. 

Silvia makes a living planting corn and beans, and raising cows. She is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural inputs. She will purchase these from the San Miguel market. Her goal is to improve her quality of life. Her challenge is the bad weather, plagues, and sickness. During her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 36-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years with her husband. They have become famous for providing good quality products and they make enough to provide for their family. To make her store fully stocked, Irshad requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour and beverages from the market at lower rates. This way, they will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Irshad wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase their business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour and beverages.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of two. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home, to support her family well. Together with her husband, Razia manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons and lace in different colors. In this way, she will be able to meet with increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Razia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons and lace different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wooden poles to support the ceiling.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
This lady with such a beautiful name, Natela, lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Natela is not married, and she lives with her parents. She graduated Kapan State Art College, department of Fine Arts. 

Now she works at the kindergarten as a teacher of painting and aesthetic education. She finds her work very interesting and does it with great love and care toward the children. As she says, she does her best in order to make the children, from their very young age, to see, to feel and to understand the art, its beauty and power. 

Naleta asks for a loan of 120,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some professional literature and some raw material for her classes.

loans.use: to buy some professional literature and some raw material for her classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes such as dresses, blouses, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 57-year-old married woman who has four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been in this business for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: María Del Lourdes

texts.es:
María de 72 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por la situación económica en que vivían sus padres, esta acompañada y su pareja es agricultor y tienen 3 hijos. 

María es comerciante desde hace años y aprendió por unas vecinas quienes se dedicaban al comercio, actualmente tiene un local en el mercado y vende frutas y verduras y se traslada en bus todos los días desde las 5:00 am hasta las 5:00 pm. 

El crédito lo necesita para terminar de construir una casa, pues necesita terminar de ponerle techo, comprara tejas, madera, hierro y pagar la mano de obra, construyéndola se sentirá con su familia mas segura. El sueño mas grande es ver terminar de construir la vivienda, ya que en época de invierno no tendrá que sufrir que se le entre el agua a su casa, pues donde vive es de lamina y tiene mucho inconveniente en la época de invierno.
texts.en:
María is 72 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study because of the financial situation of her parents. She has a companion and her partner is a farmer and they have three children.

María has been a merchant for many years and learned from some neighbors who were engaged in business. Currently she has a stand in a market, from 5:00AM until 5:00PM,  and sells fruit and vegetables, traveling by bus everyday.

She needs a loan in order to finish building a house. She needs to finish putting in the roof, to buy tiles, wood, and iron, and to pay for the labor. Constructing it will make her family feel more secure. Her biggest dream is to see her home finished as in winter the family will not suffer from water entering the home, replacing the sheeting where she lives, as it is inconvenient in the winter time.

loans.use: to buy tiles, wood, iron, and to pay for labor to put a roof on her home.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en: Hina is a 32-year-old, married woman and a mother of five. She has been running a business of cloth selling with her husband in her locality for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Hina requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. This way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She wishes to expand her business to provide a prosperous future for her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of different cloths for the summer season.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income.  With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.  Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Sifanele

texts.en:
Sifanele is a 21-year-old single mother of one who lives in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe with her parents and siblings. She has been selling clothing in her community for two years now. Sifanele also volunteers as a Learner Guide at a local secondary school, assisting students with life skills. 

With the requested loan from Kiva she intends to purchase clothes from wholesalers at a lower cost so that she will also be able to sell them at more competitive prices, attract more customers, and increase sales and profits. With an increase in profits she intends to assist her family to meet their basic needs and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor for the last four years. She is doing her job passionately; she has a thorough knowledge of the techniques of makeup and hair styling. She is a well-known beautician in her town. 

Rehana is a responsible mother of six children, and she works hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her salon, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently. She is in her eighth loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: At the age of 46, Razia is a vigorous married lady. She has two children. Eight years ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She always has a great collection to offer, and by now she has gained a good number of customers by selling good-quality fabric. Razia has earned a good income to bear her household expenditures. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. With the help of this loan, she will be able to purchase bundles of good-quality fabric. It will allow her to increase her sales to earn a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of good-quality fabric.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 46-years-old and already has 23 years of pedagogical experience. She graduated from Vanador State Architectural Institute. Now she works at the school as a teacher of mathematics. Like their mother, her two daughters are also teachers and they work at the school and do that with great devotion and pleasure and great love towards the children. Ruzanna also gives paid private courses of mathematics at her home that helps the pupils to prepare for the entrance examinations. 

Ruzanna asks for this loan in the amount of 500,000 Armenian drams since she wants to buy a computer which will be of great use, both for her and for her daughters with their teaching activities.  She also wants to buy some new professional literature, which she really lacks.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses

loans.name: Novuyo

texts.en:
Novuyo is a 25-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe. With the assistance of her family members she has been successfully running a poultry business for four years. She rears broiler chickens, producing 50 birds every six weeks. When she is not at her business Novuyo serves as a Learner Guide in her community, assisting students with their school work.  

With the requested loan Novuyo plans to make bulk purchases of chicks, feed, and vaccines. With the additional profits she intends to open a small grocery shop to earn more income to meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера — из Виноградово. Она уже пользовалась финансовой поддержкой КИВА, что, в свою очередь, помогло ей увеличить семейный доход и расширить ассортимент товара. За последнее время доход от бизнеса увеличился на 1 000 гривен и семья смогла начать строительство и обустройство собственного дома. Пока идет ремонт семье приходится проживать на квартире. 
Сумма в 30 000 гривен нужна Вере для ускорения процесса ремонта дома, а именно — чтобы облицевать керамической плиткой стены и пол в ванной, установить унитаз, умывальник и ванну; облицевать керамической плиткой пол в котельне и настелить ламинат на полу в одной из жилых комнат. Чем скорее семья закончит ремонт своего жилья, тем скорее сможет съехать с арендованного помещения и жить самостоятельно и свободно.
texts.en: Vera is from Vinogradova.  She has already received financial assistance from Kiva, which helped her to improve her family's income and increase the assortment of wares that she sells.  In the last little while the income from her business has increased by 1000 UAH and her family has been able to being building and putting together their own home.  The family is living in an apartment during the building.  Vera needs 30,000 UAH to accelerate the house building process.  Specifically, she needs to put in ceramic tile on the walls and floor in the bathroom and install a toilet, wash basin, and bathtub, put ceramic tiles on the floor of the boiler room, and install laminate in one of the living rooms.  The sooner they can finish the repairs on their home, the sooner they can stop renting their apartment and life independently and free.

loans.use: to do house repairs

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leni is 60 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Leni has a general store business in the Philippines. Leni requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Leni has been in this business for 4 years. Leni would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is 43 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Leslie works very hard to provide for them.

Leslie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell. Leslie has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Leslie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Junior

texts.en:
Junior is an old client of the organization who has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings. This 28-year-old man is married and blessed with four kids. He hails from Rukungiri district in Western Uganda. 

He operates a retail shop with a small bar as his major source of income. However, he has been faced with limited capital and competition to compete favorably in the market. With this loan from UGAFODE, Junior is hopeful that his dreams will come true and his businesses will improve gradually.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, actualmente esta divorciado y tiene 1 hijo que vive con su madre y que estudia 5º grado.

Él  vive solo en casa y siempre le da manutención a su hijo. Desde hace 20 años es mecánico y aprendió debido a que su padre tenia un taller donde reparaban carros y poco a poco le fue gustando y así aprendió.

José es empleado de un taller, donde viaja para llegar en bus todos lo días 40 mts, su horario es de 8:00 am a 5:00 pm. 

Necesita del crédito, para comprar llaves, pulidora, grasa, repuestos, esprayadora, etc. quiere comprar unas herramientas de trabajo, ya que en su casa hace trabajos de mecánica y no cuenta con algunas herramientas mas avanzadas que le puedan servir para realizar el trabajo.

 El sueño es tener un local propio para montar un taller y tener sus clientes, y el otro sueño es que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old, He studied through the first year of high school. Currently he is divorced and has one child that lives with his mother and is in the 5th grade.

He lives alone at home and always gives support for his child. He has been a mechanic since he was twenty years old and learned because his father had a workshop repairing cars and little by little he was enjoying it and so he learned.

José is a workshop employee, traveling by bus every day, forty meters, his hours are from 8:00AM until 5:00PM.

He needs a loan to buy keys, polisher, grease, spare parts, a sprayer, etc, and wants to buy some tools, as he does mechanic work at home and he does not have some more advanced tools that would help him do his work.

His dream is to have his own facility where he could have a workshop and have his clients, and his other dream is for his son to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy keys, polisher, grease, spare parts, a sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lucena has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Lucena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Tulio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, oficios que  practica desde hace cinco años, trabaja junto a su familia; José está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo, su lucha constante es proveer de una buena alimentación vestuario y salud a su familia.
Lo utilizara para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas, fertilizantes y herbicidas, para realizar la siembra de granos básicos, así como también comprara cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, de esta manera fortalecerá lo suficiente su negocio para tener recursos económicos con los que cubrirá los gastos familiares y el pago de su deuda.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio más amplio, aumentar su rentabilidad y ofrecer un estilo de vida más confortable a su familia.
texts.en:
José works growing basic grains and raises pigs, work that he has done for five years, working with his family. José has a companion and lives with his life partner and a son. He struggles constantly to provide good food, clothing, and health for his family.

He is going to buy compost, seed, fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides, and herbicides for the basic grain harvest, as well as also buy pigs and concentrate for feeding them, in this way strengthening his business enough to have financial resources to cover the household expenses and make the loan payments.

His dream is to have a larger business, increasing profitability and offering a more comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, seed, fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides, herbicides, pigs and feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower Gloria continues to sell clothes for a living. She sells pants, blouses, and polo shirts. She has been in this business for many years now, and it is going very well.

Her dream is to have a dollar store. She is requesting this loan to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

The borrower is happy that she has received a loan and commits to repaying the installments.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Pool Alonso

texts.es:
Pool es una joven que hace poco terminó el colegio, es soltero, tiene 18 años y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde hace 1 año trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante, preparando diversos platillos de excelente calidad. Es una persona muy responsable, honesto, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su familia.
Pool está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un televisor para que pueda disfrutar sus horas de ocio viendo sus programas preferidos, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y él seguirá esforzándose para poder crecer profesionalmente y apoyar a su familia en todo lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Pool is a young man who recently finished school. He is single, 18 years old and lives in Ica with his family.

He has been working for a year as a kitchen helper in a restaurant, preparing various dishes of excellent quality. He is a responsible and honest person eager to get ahead and support his family.

Pool is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the given support he can buy a television so he can enjoy his leisure hours watching his favorite programs, and so will improve his quality of life and he will continue to grow professionally and support his family every way he can.

loans.use: to buy a television

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en: Keneth is a 50-year-old widower with five children, two of whom still attend school. He performs cattle fattening which he has done for over seven years. He hails from Rukungiri district in Western Uganda. Keneth is an long-time client of the organization. He took a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings which he will use to buy more cows for sale and increase his income. His dream is to expand his businesses to greater heights. With this loan from UGAFODE, Keneth is hopeful his business is going to expand.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Norma  Maria

texts.es:
La socia Norma Maria se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower Norma Maria continues to work for a living in a grocery store. She sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8am to 7pm. She has worked in this business for 5 years now, and it is going very well.

This borrower's dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is requesting this loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Betsy Johny

texts.es:
Betsy, vive en casa familiar en compañía de su hija, un nieto y su madre; por necesidad de costear los gastos de su familia hace 10 años inicio su propio negocio de venta de ropa, cosméticos, bisutería y enchape, trabaja todos los días de nueve de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, ya cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes establecida, actualmente su negocio no representa dificultades.
Comprará variedad de ropa, pulseras, aretes, anillos, cadenas, collares, lociones, labiales, polvos, exfoliantes, entre otros productos, esto le generara mayor facilidad para complacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir teniendo ganancias con las que cumplirá con el pago de los diferentes compromisos económicos que tiene bajo su responsabilidad.
Su sueño es tener los recursos económicos para apoyar a su hija a culminar sus estudios universitarios y construir una cochera en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Betsy lives in the family house with her daughter, a grandson, and her mother.  She started her own business ten years ago out of the necessity to pay for the family expenses.  She sells clothes, cosmetics, and costume and plated jewelry.  She works every day from nine in the morning until four in the afternoon.  She now has a good portfolio of established customers.  Her business does not currently have any difficulties.

She will buy a variety of clothes, bracelets, earrings, rings, chains, necklaces, lotions, lipsticks, powders, and exfoliants, among other products.  This will make it easier to meet her customers’ demands and to continue having income to cover the different financial commitments that are her responsibility.

Her dream is to have the financial resources to help her daughter finish her university education and to build a garage at her house.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes, bracelets, earrings, rings, chains, necklaces, lotions, lipsticks, powders, and exfoliants, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to implement a business of sale of clothes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 48-year-old widow who has been blessed with two children.  Since the demise of her husband, Helen has been operating a second hand clothing business and renting chairs for functions for nine years. She earns an income of 10,000 KES.

Helen is now servicing her fourth loan of 70,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to add more stock of second hand clothes to boost her business with more and various designs to meet the expectations of her clients.

Helen plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and be able to further their education to higher levels.  She hopes to have a stable life with a bright future for her children.

loans.use: To add more stock of clothes to her second hand business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz works hard to support her family. Luz is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Luz requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Luz has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Olga Carmita

texts.es:
Olga tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres e hijos de 13 y 10 años  de edad en la comunidad Pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Olga se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frejol y mora. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento del cultivo de mora. La compra lo realiza en mercado de San Miguel. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Su desafío es el mal tiempo, plagas y enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Olga is 36 years old. She is single. She lives with her parents and her children, ages 13 and 10, in the community of Pailaloma, which belongs to the San Miguel canton in the province of Bolivar.

She is a member of the Patrón San Miguel loan group, which is located in the Pailaloma community, some 40 minutes from the office of the cooperative, which works with agricultural borrowers.

Olga  raises corn, beans, and blackberries. She is applying for the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to maintain her blackberry plantings. She makes her purchases in the San Miguel market. Her goal is to improve her living conditions. Her challenges are bad weather, plagues, and diseases. In her free time she likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, forma parte de una familia muy unida, vive junto a sus tres hijas de 18, 16 y 13 años de edad, de las cuales la mayor trabaja mientras que las otras dos estudian; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, oficio que aprendió de su madre y desde hace 12 años trabaja de manera independiente, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., al realizar esta actividad genera ingresos con los que costea los gastos de su hogar.
Comprará blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior para ambos sexos y trajes para niños/as, diversificadas en estilos, colores y tallas, así tendrá nuevas prendas con las que espera satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas.
Su sueño es establecer su negocio en un local en el que pueda tener la facilidad de aumentar la mercadería y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is part of a very close family. She lives with her three daughters, who are 18, 16 and 13 years old. The oldest one works while the other are students. She works selling clothes, a job she learned from her mother. She has been self-employed for 12 years . Her schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. With this job she earns income to pay for her household expenses. She will buy blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, underwear for both sexes and suits for boys and girls, diversifying in styles, colors and sizes. This way she will have new clothing items with which to satisfy her customers' taste and increase her sales. Her dream is to establish her business in a place where it will be easier for her to increase her merchandise and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, underwear for both sexes and suits for boys and girls.

loans.name: Gerardo Eliecer

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijo de 16, 14, 10, 8 y 5 años de edad, en la comunidad Pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Gerardo se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, frejol y arveja. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes. La compra lo realiza en el mercado de San Miguel. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus sembríos. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con sus hijos y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 52, is married and lives with his wife and children, ages 16, 14, 10, 8 and 5, in the Pailaloma community, which belongs to the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province. He is a member of the communal bank Patrón San Miguel ("Patron Saint Miguel"), which is located in the Pailaloma community, about 40 minutes from the office of the cooperative. The members work in agriculture.

Gerardo makes a living in farming, cultivating corn, beans and peas. He is requesting the loan so that he can buy compost and fertilizer. He will make this purchase in the market of San Miguel. 

His goal is to improve the production of his crops. His challenges are the climate and the pests on his crops. In his free time, he likes to be with his children and watch television.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Jojie

texts.en:
Ma. Jojie is 40 years old and is married with four children who are in school. 

Ma. Jojie is in the agricultural business.  She raises cattle in the Philippines. Ma. Jojie requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Ma. Jojie has been raising cattle for 7 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Jojie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Vidal Dolores

texts.es:
La sopa de res es la especialidad de Vidal.  A las doce del mediodía su comedor se encuentra lleno de personas que buscan deleitarse con este delicioso caldo. Las recetas son una herencia de su abuelita, sin embargo, ella le agrega su sazón única e inigualable, que tanto gusta al público que visita su local.  La venta de comida le brinda buenas ganancias y es el sustento para ella y su familia. 
El negocio  marcha de maravilla. KIVA Y MiCrédito han sido un pilar fundamental en todo este proyecto, ellos siempre le brindan el capital necesario cada vez que necesita dinero extra. Vidal desea que su comedor siga llenándose de clientes.  Ella planea agregar nuevos platillos a su menú,  por eso  solicitó otro préstamo  a esta misma institución, para la compra de granos básicos, plátanos, aceite, carne y pollo. Las nuevas recetas atraerán más visitantes a su local.
texts.en:
Beef soup is Vidal’s specialty. At noon her food stall is full of people looking to enjoy this delicious broth. The recipes are passed down from her grandmother, nonetheless, she adds her unique and incomparable seasoning, so much loved by the visitors to her stand. The sale of food gives her good profits and is the livelihood for her and her family.

Business is wonderful. Kiva and MiCrédito have been a mainstay in this entire project, always offering her the funds each time extra money was needed. Vidal hopes that her food stall continues being filled with customers. She plans to add new dishes to her menu, and this is why she is asking for another loan from the same institution, in order to buy basic grains, bananas, oil, meat and chicken. New recipes will attract more visitors to her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bananas, oil, meat and chicken

loans.name: Elías

texts.es:
Elías de 46 años de edad, no pudo cursar ningún tipo de estudio,  ya que la condición económica de sus padres no era la ideal para enviarlos a la escuela a ninguno de sus hijos.  Elías tiene 3 hijos quienes ya no dependen de él,  son mayores de edad.

Elías se ha dedicado a trabajar la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, ya que su padre le inculco a este tipo de actividad hoy en día se ha dedicado a trabajar ya por su cuenta 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz,  también se dedica a trabajar en una hacienda cuidando animales esto lo hace todos los días tiene que madrugar para que pueda trasladarse y poder terminar con las vacas de ordeño muy temprano, en época de lluvia se dedica a la agricultura propia cultivando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, fertilizantes para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

Desea seguir trabajando y terminar una pequeña casa que a comenzado a construir.
texts.en:
Elías, who is 46 years old, was not able to pursue any type of education, since the economic condition of his parents was not ideal to send any of their children to school. Elías has three children who already do not depend on him. They are adults.

Elías has worked in agriculture since he was very young, since his parents instilled this type of work in him. Today he has already worked, by his own account, 7000 square meters of corn. He also works at a ranch, caring for animals. He does this every day. He has to get up early so that he can travel there and be able to finish milking the cows very early. In the rainy season he does his own farming, raising 7000 square meters of corn.

He is applying to CrediCampo for a loan to buy compost and fertilizers to raise 7000 square meters of corn.

He wants to continue working and finish a small house that he has begun to construct.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to raise 7000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: María Ernestina

texts.es:
María de 78 años de edad, los padres de  ella eran de muy escasos recursos económicos  y sin la posibilidad de darles el estudio a todos sus hijos,  solo lograron que pudiese cursar su hija hasta un 3º grado, ya que tenía que ayudar a su madre para terminar con lo necesario para que su padre y sus hermanos se pudiesen trasladar al trabajo, sus hijos ya mayores de edad ya han formado su propia  familia solo vive con una nieta.

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de antojitos esto lo hace por las tardes para obtener un ingreso para mantenerse y sentirse útil.
La venta empieza al medio día a preparar el producto para que estén listos para ser vendidos por la tarde, le ayuda la nieta que vive con ella.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para compra lámina y poder arreglar una parte de la  vivienda que está mal el techo y en la temporada de lluvia se moja buena parte de la casa.

Su objetivo es continuar trabajando y ayudar a seguir adelante a su nieta para que tenga buenos principios.
texts.en:
María is 78 years old. Her parents were very financially disadvantaged, and were unable to provide studies to all of their children. They only were able to allow their daughter to study through third grade, since she had to help her mother to finish the necessary chores so that her father and siblings could go to work. Her children are already adults, and have formed their own families. She lives only with her granddaughter. 

María makes a living doing domestic chores and selling snacks, which she does in the afternoons to obtain an income to sustain herself and feel useful. She starts preparing the products at mid-day so that they are ready to be sold in the afternoon. She is helped by the granddaughter who lives with her.

The loan she is requesting from Credicampo is to buy sheet metal so she can fix a part of her home where the roof is bad, since in the rainy season a large part of the house gets wet. Her goal is to continue working and help her granddaughter get ahead and have good principles.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal so she can fix a part of her home where the roof is bad, since in the rainy season a large part of the house gets wet

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, necesita más capital para surtir su negocio con frutas y verduras frescas, puesto que la demanda de sus productos es mayor actualmente, comprara zanahorias, pipianes, piñas, melones, sandias, elotes, ejotes, güisquiles, plátanos, manzanas, guineos, repollos, tomates, etc., con lo que seguirá contando con la preferencia de sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior se ha mantenido trabajando y teniendo ingresos para mejorar su situación económica. Nuevamente ha tenido la dicha de ser madre, su familia le brinda apoyo incondicional para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carolina needs more funds in order to supply her business with fresh fruit and vegetables, since the demand for her products is currently higher. She will buy carrots, squash, pineapples, melons, watermelons, corn, green beans, chayotes, bananas, apples, guineos (bananas) cabbage, tomatoes, etc, so that she can continue supplying her customers with their preferences.

With the previous loan she has continued working and having income in order to improve her financial situation. She has again had the joy of being a mother, and her family gives her unconditional support to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy buy carrots, squash, pineapples, melons, watermelons, corn, green beans, chayotes, bananas, apples, guineos (bananas) cabbage, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Sihua Orqo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SIHUA ORQO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria ella es conviviente y tiene 32 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Sihua Orqo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associates belong to the "SIHUA ORQO" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Coya, belonging to the province of Calca and the area of Cuzco. 

The associate is Mrs. Maria; she is a partner, is 32 years old, and has one child. The associate works to raise and sell animals; the associate raises guinea pigs and chickens; she lets them grow and become bigger, then she sells them at the different markets. Through this small business, the associate helps her children to carry on; the associate's dream is to have a place where she is able to sell the guinea pigs and chickens. The associate asks for a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as food for the guinea pigs and chickens.

The associate who is covered with a circle on her face does not belong to the Sihua Orqo communal bank.

The other associates make a living through handcraft sales, the agriculture business, a business selling groceries, and in the selling of animals.

The associate is thankful to those who are a part of her dream in this way, and she promises to fulfill her obligation to pay back her loans in the established installments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as food for the guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn on the cob, oil, bananas, mangoes, pineapples, watermelons, papayas, and bags.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.es:
Kevin vive en Lima junto a su madre y tíos, sus padres son separados y su padre no aporta económicamente en nada desde que se fue. El es hijo único y ayuda a su madre en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de luces para fiestas, única fuente de ingresos familiares de forma directa, ya que sus tíos si bien aportan en los pagos del hogar, no pueden ayudarlo con sus gastos de estudios.
El negocio de su madre es eventual, por lo que el ingreso de dinero es esporádico y no alcanza para pagar la carrera de Kevin en el instituto. Pronto tendrá que dejarla para comenzar a trabajar de no contar con la ayuda de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Kevin desea agradecer de antemano cualquier ayuda que pueda recibir por parte de los prestamistas de Kiva, ayuda que le permitirá cumplir su sueño de terminar su carrera de dibujo mecánico y en un futuro trabajar en lo que tanto le gusta.
El quiere decirle a los prestamistas de Kiva que se siente bendecido con la oportunidad de ser beneficiado por ellos y que no los defraudara, que estudiara mucho para terminar sus estudios y ser un hombre de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Kevin lives in Lima together with his mother and her siblings. His parents are separated and his father hasn't provided any economic support since he left. 

Kevin is an only child and helps his mother in her small business renting lights for parties, which is the only source of direct family income. His aunts and uncles do help with household expenses, but are unable to support him with tuition costs.

His mother's business is event-based, so the income from it is sporadic and isn't enough to pay for Kevin's course of study in the institute. Without relying on the help of Kiva lenders, he will soon have to leave it to begin working.

Kevin would like to thank Kiva lenders in advance for any help he can receive, which will help him fulfill his dream of finishing his career in mechanical design and having a future working on what he likes so much.

He would like to tell Kiva lenders that he feels blessed with the opportunity to be helped by them and that he will not defraud them, that he will study very hard to finish his degree and be a good man for society.

loans.use: to pay for his technical studies in mechanical design.

loans.name: Catherine Pamela

texts.es:
Catherine vive sola con su madre, su padre las abandono cuando ella apenas tenia dos años de edad. Su madre realiza labores de limpieza en un colegio y gana el sueldo mínimo.
Catherine es una joven muy inteligente y estudiosa, esta a la mitad de su carrera en control de calidad textil y ya esta realizando practicas pre-profesionales en una empresa por lo que percibe un ingreso mínimo que apenas le alcanza para cubrir parte de su pensión educativa.
El pequeño sueldo de su madre solo basta para cubrir los gastos de la casa por lo que Catherine no tendrá otra alternativa que dejar eventualmente sus estudios y comenzar a trabajar a tiempo completo hasta poder retomarlos mas adelante de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Ella desea continuar con sus estudios y ser tomada en cuenta en la empresa donde actualmente realiza practicas para trabajar en el área de control de calidad y poder así ayudar a su madre que tanto a hecho por ella.
Es por esto que Catherine agradece toda la ayuda que le brindan los prestamistas de Kiva al ser beneficiada con este apoyo. Ella piensa que con la ayuda que brindan tan desinteresadamente los prestamistas de Kiva, no solo esta aportando a que miles de jóvenes puedan culminar sus estudios, sino también a hacer realidad miles de sueños.
texts.en:
Catherine lives with only her mother; her father abandoned them when she was barely two years old. Her mother works as a cleaning woman at a high school and earns minimum wage.

Catherine is a very intelligent and studious young woman. She is halfway through her Textile Quality Control degree. She is already doing a pre-professional internship at a business, which provides her with a minimal income that hardly covers a part of her tuition.

Her mother's small salary is only enough to cover household expenses, so Catherine will not have any option but to eventually give up her studies and start working full time until she can go back to school later, unless she receives support from Kiva lenders.

She wants to continue going to school and be noticed at the business where she currently is doing her internship, so she can work in quality control and be able to support her mother, who has done so much for her.
