As a recipient of their support, Catherine is grateful for all the help that Kiva lenders provide. She believes that thorugh Kiva lenders' generous help, they are not only enabling thousands of young people to finish their studies, but are also making thousands of dreams a reality.

loans.use: to pay her tuition to study Textile Quality Control

loans.name: Filgona

texts.en:
Filgona has applied for her second business loan to help her buy more stock of fish to sell. She is 55 years old, married and blessed with two school going children.

She serviced her previous loan successfully. Her business is doing so well in that her monthly income is KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

Filgona hopes to grow her business and start selling fish in bulk.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 39 years old and married. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks, such as canned goods, noodles, vinegar, coffee, sugar, and other groceries to resell.

Milagros has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, noodles, vinegar, coffee, sugar, and other groceries. 

Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks, such as canned goods, noodles, vinegar, coffee, sugar, and other groceries to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine beside the first one.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 36 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Naomi is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business.

Naomi has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Naomi would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is an old client of the institution. He is married with five children, and he sells goats and cows as his major source of income. He has been in this business for over 15 years. 

David is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) to expand his business and earn more profits. He thanks UGAFODE, whose support has enabled him to educate his children. He hopes with this loan he will be able meet his entire family's financial obligations and sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cows.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is an old client to the organization, who has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX). She is 42 years old and widowed with three children. She has a retail shop as her main source of income, which she has done for over 20 years. 

It’s from this business that she has been able to get income and meet her family needs. However, she has been faced with the challenge of limited capital for expanding her business. With this loan from UGAFODE, she is hopeful that she can expand her business and continue to support her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, cinnamon, leavening, and a means of transportation, a motorcycle, to distribute her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a repeat client to the organization, who recently took a loan of 4,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX). The 47-year-old man is married and blessed with three kids, all of whom are attending school. He hails from Rukungiri municipality where he carries out a secondhand clothing business. 

His main challenges have been limited capital and tough competition. He has a dream of expanding his business, and with this loan from UGAFODE, Godfrey is hopeful that his business will improve, since he will be able to compete favorably in the market. 

He is thankful to Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial assistance rendered to him.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sr. De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Purificación ella es casada y tiene 51 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia también tiene un pequeño negocio que es una tienda escolar donde vende sándwich, gaseosas y galletas, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These communal bank members belong to the communal bank "Señor de Torrechayoc II." This group is located in the district of Urubamba, which is part of the province of Urubamba and the district of Cusco.

This bank member is Señora Maria Purificación. She is married and is 51 years old. She has 6 children. She works in her business of raising and selling animals. She also has a small business which is a school store, where she sells sandwiches, soft drinks, and cookies. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. She raises and fattens them and then sells them at various fairs. Through this small business, she is raising her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens. She is applying for the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and food for them.

The other members have handicraft and agricultural businesses, a grocery store, and an animal-selling business.

This bank member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and food for them.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 53 years old and has six children. Prescila is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Prescila is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Prescila requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Prescila has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Prescila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rebecca is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rebecca has a dress-making business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials, such as fabrics, threads, buttons, etc. for her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, such as fabrics, threads, buttons, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy clothes, hair, etc.

loans.name: Nokhuthular

texts.en: Nokuthula is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been rearing broiler chickens for six months now. At the moment she has the capacity to produce 25 broiler chickens within a period of six weeks. She was encouraged by other CAMA (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into entrepreneurship so that she could meet the financial needs of her and her family. Nokuthula also volunteers as a Community Health Trainer, disseminating health information to schools in and around her community. With the requested loan Nokuthula intends to purchase more chicks, feed, and vaccines so that she can increase the number of broilers she produces every six weeks. With the additional profits she will be able to pay the school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Nueva Estrella y forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas por medio de las capacitaciones y trabajo arduo podrán ir mejorando su situación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, una mujer por mas dedicada y que se esfuerza por ir mejorando, lucha día a día y comenta que a diario se levanta a muy tempranas horas a preparar las comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender.
Con el propósito de poder seguir trabajando pide este préstamo, ya que quiere comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called “Nueva Estrella” (New Star) and is participating in the poverty elimination program. Through all of their training and hard work, they will be able to improve their situations.

One of the members is Sra. Rosa. She is a very devoted woman who is striving to improve day after day. Rosa says that she wakes up extremely early every morning in order to prepare the food that she will sell later in the day.

In order to continue working, she is requesting a loan. Rosa wants to buy supplies so that she can continue preparing food, such as vegetables, condiments, meat, and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru:
Тамара — предпринимательница из Новой Каховки. Она занимается торговлей в нескольких населенных пунктах области, арендуя торговые точки у администрации рынков. Торгует в основном женской одеждой и обувью. Этим бизнесом занимается уже 7 лет. 
Сумма в 21 000 гривен понадобилась Тамаре для того, чтобы подкупить ходовой летний товар, обувь и одежду на продажу. Тамара уже запланировала поездку для закупки товара, но имеющихся у нее в наличии финансов недостаточно для покупки нужной партии товара. Полученные от реализации товара средства Тамара планирует реинвестировать в бизнес и потратить на нужды семьи.
texts.en: Tamara is a businesswoman from New Kahovka.  She does retail sales in several villages in the region, renting retail stalls at the local markets.  She sells primarily women's clothing and shoes, and has been working in this business for 7 years.  Tamara needs 21,000 UAH to buy popular summer items, shoes, and clothing to sell.  Tamara has already planned a trip to buy the goods, but does not have enough financial resources on hand to purchase the necessary items.  Tamara plans to use the money she earns from selling her wares to meet the needs of her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing and footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Molline

texts.en:
Molline has been a very successful business lady. She makes dresses and sells these clothes to her customers, who have been increasing. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. Molline is a married lady with two children, who are six years old and eight months old respectively.

She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family. In the future she plans to grow her business and open a training school for tailoring.

loans.use: to buy more fabric materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Bersey

texts.en: Bersey is an 18-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for four months, producing 25 birds every six weeks. She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into business so that she could reverse the cycle of poverty within her family. During her spare time, Bersey volunteers at her local schools assisting the students with study and life skills. With the requested loan, Bersey intends to buy more chicks, feed and feeding troughs to extend her fowl run. This would enable her to increase her production. With the additional profits she plans to better provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, feed and feeding troughs to extend her fowl run

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 19-year-old Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member and businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothing for men and women. Apart from running her business, Elizabeth volunteers assisting the elderly in her community with daily chores.  With the requested loan she intends to buy more clothes, bags and shoes to increase her sales. With the additional profits she intends to enroll at a teacher’s college and train as a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to increase her stock by buying more clothes, bags and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
Насибе 40 лет. Она обыкновенная сельская женщина района Пяндж, занимающаяся сельским хозяйством. Насиба замужем, ее муж работает в Министерстве обороны. У них двое детей в возрасте 10 и 14 лет. Они учатся  в местной школе. Насиба в течение 10 лет вместе с братом и сестрой занимается посевом и сбором урожая. Сейчас она за счет кредита хочет купить семена и минеральные удобрения для того чтобы провести очередной посев.   
В будущем Насиба планирует арендовать еще 50 соток земельного участка и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Nasiba is 40 years old.  She is an ordinary, rural woman from Pyandj, and works in agriculture.  Nasiba is married, and her husband works in the Ministry of Defense.  She has two children who are 10 and 14 years old and study at the local school.  Nasiba, her brother, and her sister have been farming for 10 years.  Nasiba hopes to get a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting.  In the future, Nasiba plans to rent an additional 50 acres of land and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Clare Esnath

texts.en: Clare is a 26-year-old businesswoman from the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe. She is single and has one child. To support her family, Clare has been successfully operating a shoe business at a local flea market for the past two years.  She is also a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who delivers  life skills training in schools in her area. Clare would like to purchase more clothes and shoes using the loan from Kiva. This would grow her business by boosting sales and generating higher profits. With the increased profits she will pay her child’s school fees and enroll herself in a teacher’s college.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.
